As a Suikoden veteran, I approached Eiyuden Chronicle: Hundred Heroes with sky-high expectations - which, admittedly, might have worked against my experience. While the visuals are stunning, other aspects fall short when inevitably compared to its spiritual predecessor.

It's a decent JRPG in its own right, but the weight of nostalgia and expectations made it difficult to judge purely on its own merits. Surprisingly, I found myself enjoying Rising, its prequel, slightly more. While I'm still interested in seeing where the series goes, Hundred Heroes lands firmly in the 'good, not great' category."

Absolutely amazing game, hard to put into words how much I love this. The varied cast leaves a lot of choice and the game is not so difficult that you're heavily punished for not using the strongest characters. The game has plenty customisation in this way, you could potentially have every run of the game have different dialogue depending on who you bring. Even characters from the end of the game have dialogues in early quests.

Gradually building up a base and recruiting more and more heroes to fill it is so engaging to me, especially with all the personalities on show, and all voiced too.

The story really managed to grab me in its hold, combined with the phenomenal music I got chills in so many story segments.

Definitely one of my new favourite games, and my favourite of 2024. Also played Rising before Hundred Heroes and I'd fully recommend that too.

I'm a bit conflicted on this game...I wanted to like the game especially with Suikoden 2 being one of my favorite games growing up. I 100%'d this and also 100% Eiyuden Chronicle: Rising, but honestly it was brutal up until the last moment. There are also some great things in the game such as the graphics, don't get me wrong but it's overwhelmed by some core issues. If I had to really sum up the game: it was shallow in its mechanics/story, and egregiously stretched for time.

-The story is incoherent, largely guided by characters without personality or purpose. There is no Luca Blight-level antagonist, and we are confronted by Dux Aldric who falls short of driving urgency/purpose to the plot. Most of the characters are forgettable and there's little substance to make you care about most of them. I wish if they had reduced the hero count by half they could do a better job than watering it down to the 120 on the recruitable roster. Focus on ~30 heroes and their backgrounds that involve more than just fetching an item or finishing a dungeon w/them. The characters of Suikoden really propped up an otherwise average PSX-era franchise...it comes nowhere close to that with Eiyuden.
-The strategic battles and the majority of minigames are extremely shallow and need significant rework/depth. I felt many of them were there just because it was part of a Kickstarter stretch goal and not properly thought through. The egg/culinary minigames especially felt like an immense slog to get through. Honestly, scrap some of the minigames (shark/egg racing), double-down on the strategic fights and expand them...have those fights turn into tactical fights to bolster experience for non-core characters. The game should capture the essence of war and the stakes of a tyrant imminent in achieving his goals of domination.
-Combat is boring and you'll likely hit auto on enemies you've encountered before. The boss battles have some redeeming features with gimmicks employed, but the overall combat experience is lacking. Spells and abilities need to be better optimized. Having a method for non-core characters to gain experience/screentime needs to be revamped.

여러모로 분명 더 잘 만들 수 있을텐데 하는 아쉬운 느낌이 드는 게임. 
고전 인카운터 턴제 jrpg 전투방식 상 많은 동료에서 골라 짜는 재미보단 레벨로 찍어누르는 방식으로 귀결되는 반복 노가다성 전투..의외로 유니콘 오버로드같이 자동전투에도 작전을 짜놓는 시스템이 존재하지만 그게임처럼 디테일하지도 않고 스킬 mp연비가 굉장히 구리다는점과 인벤토리가 협소하다는점과 mp수급이 사실상 없다시피 할 정도로 빡세다는 점이 시너지를 일으켜 결국은 필드진행에서는 자동수급되는 sp고유기랑 평타만 쓰는 전투만 진행하고 보스전은 수동으로 진행하기에 의미없음. 

편의성도 솔직히 세이브포인트부분이나 파티편성을 제한시키는 것 자체는 이해할 수 있음. 스토리상 주요던전의 경우 편성을 짤 수 있도록 입구에서 편성가능하도록 배치시킨 점 등 제작진이 나름 배려했다는 느낌이 있긴 했음. 그게 유저입장에서 충분한가 하는건 별개이지만....근데 룬 장비를 그렇게 제한해두는건 이 게임을 깬 지금시점에서도 이해할 수 없음. 던전 필드에서 괜찮아보이는 룬을 구해도 그상태에서 사용할 방법없이 인벤토리만 한칸 차지하는 애물단지가 되어버리니...

미니게임도 동료를 모두 모으기 위해 강제되는데 이게 또 굉장히 지루함. 특히 팽이는 그렇게 만들면 안됐음. 팽이는 걍 무조건 상대보다 강한 팽이로 스킬만 딸깍하는 단순한 방식인데 이게 계단식 성장이 아닌 잡몹을 잡으면 낮은 확률로 해당 팽이를 얻는 방식이라 진행중에 팽이를 못얻었다면 첫판이후론 아예 손도 못대는 컨텐츠가 되어버림. 차라리 용과같이 미니카마냥 대전에서 이기면 업그레이드가 가능한 형식이었어야 하지않았나 싶음. 비슷하게 악명높은 요리의 경우 탐험및 스토리진행도중 회복겸 들릴때마다 하다보니 팽이만큼 스트레스받진 않았지만 이걸 몰아서 한다면 팽이보다 더 지옥일 수도 있을듯...

60시간이 넘는 플레이타임도 사실상 퍼즐이라는 형식을 빌린 동선 뺑뺑이 돌리기식이고 거기에 부족한 편의성들이 시너지를 일으켜 실제 메인 분량은 의외로 많지 않음. 수많은 동료들도 각자의 설정이라던가 특성이라던가 하는건 분명 짜놓았지만 인게임에서 푸는 동료는 상당히 한정적임. 특히 백영웅전 라이징에서 나온 등장인물들도 이게임에서 동료로 나오는데 주인공3인방 외엔 나머지 애들이 서로 접점이라 할게 없다시피함. 분명 라이징에서 각자 서로 교류가 있었음에도..

이 동료들의 성격/컨셉들을 직접적으로 체험할 수 있는 갓요소가 있으니 바로 연극..이 게임을 사서 플레이 한다면 이건 꼭 하길 권한다. 정해진 총 5개의 대본에서 각자의 배역에 100명이 넘는 동료들을 입맛대로 조합해 볼 수 있는데 이게 풀더빙으로 이루어져 ㄹㅇ 개꿀잼임. 그나마 주연/엑스트라 할거없이 동료들 각자의 사람냄새를 맡아볼 수 있는 진주같은 컨텐츠이다. 다만 이 대본을 얻는 방식이 운에 기대는 방식인데 특정 마을의 도구점에서 비밀물품마냥 '확률'로 팔고있음(이렇게 파는게 레시피랑 대본인데 상점리젠 시간간격이 30분이라는 소문이...). 즉 공략없이 운이 없으면 구경도 못할 수 있는 컨텐츠라는게 함정임. 심지어 이 연극을 개방하는 동료가 그 마을 도구점에서 파는 대본을 갖다줘야 합류하는 동료라 상점 세이브로드 노가다를 해야 해서 이건 걍 치트나 트레이너를 사용하는걸 권함. 솔직히 레시피는 몰라도 대본은 랜덤이 아니라 확정으로 구할 수 있게 만들었어야 했다 봄

전쟁의 경우 본인이 모은 동료들에 맞춰 편성이 가능하지만 전략시뮬게임마냥 깊이가 있진 않고 동료들이 어떤 능력을 가졌는가에 대한 대략적인 모양새만 갖춘정도..결국은 rpg장르라 전쟁이 빡셀경우 새로운 스트레스요소로 변질될 우려가 있어 이해못할 요소는 아님. 그래도 나름 기병대만 편성할 경우 2칸이동이 가능하다던가 스킬에서 특정병종에만 강화를 준다거나 하는 등 소소한 디테일은 있음. 동료들의 전쟁용 sd조형정도는 구현해서 전투시 걔네들이 치고박는걸 보여줬더라면 그래도 보는맛이라도 있었을텐데 하는 아쉬움정도...혹시나 후속작이 나온다면 전쟁에서 동료고유 sd는 적용해주었으면 함.

일기토는 기존 환상수호전의 가위바위보 싸움이라기보단 기모아서 터뜨리는 방식에 가까워서 능동적인 전투컨텐츠라기보단 연출로서의 성격이 강함. 다만 이 연출이 기대보다 우수한 편이었음. 걍 보스전 이기고 이벤트신 나오는 것 보다 더 몰입감이 좋았음. 개인적으로 타 게임에서 자주 사용하는 QTE방식보다 높게 평가해 주고 싶음.


스토리에대한 감상은 스포가 있으니 주의바람(가능한 클리어한 사람만 읽기를...). 요약하자면 스토리자체는 무난하고 완결성도 괜찮지만 세부적으로 구멍이 좀 있고 분량이 생각보다 적고 특히 후반부가 부실함.

스토리도 나름 왕도적인 판타지물이면서 갈등과 위기 등이 적절히 섞인 무난한 스토리임. 억지스러운 뇌절 반전도 딱히 없고 알기 쉬우면서도 깔끔한 편..주인공진영이 적에게 선빵맞고 몰락했다가 재기하지만 적의 반응에 다시 위기에 빠지다 반격하여 결국 승리하는 이야기라 간추릴 수 있음. 문제는 환상수호전처럼 동료를 모아야 하는데 이 동료를 유저가 능동적으로 모을 수 있는 시점이 위기까지이고 반격하는 시점부턴 스토리로만 합류함. 정확히는 걔네들이 합류하고 반격시작인데 이 반격파트가 너무나 분량이 짧고 부실함. 이 게임을 하면서 아직 중반일텐데 왜 동료가 벌써 100명이 넘는건가 싶은 불안감이 생겼었고 그 불안감은 적중함. 반격 및 탈환부분에서 갑자기 나레이션 한줄로 퉁치고 이벤트 씬 몇개로 넘어가는데 솔직히 이 부분도 유저가 직접 진행했어야 하는거 아닌가 싶었음. 뭐 마지막 끝맺음 자체는 큰 줄기면에서 깔끔하게 맺었지만 중간에 있어야 할 부분이 잘렸다는 느낌이 들었음.
또 중간에 포로를 한 명 잡는데 굳이 포로로 만들어놓고 주인공측이 이를 증인으로 삼는다던가 정보를 빼낸다던가 동료로 회유한다거나 하는거 없이 걍 방치해버림. 심지어 이 포로는 라이징에서도 주요 악역일 정도의 비중인데도...물론 이 포로가 걍 맥거핀마냥 버려지진 않고 마지막에 아군측에 한방 먹이는데 이게 주인공측이 자초했다싶을만큼 어거지로 느껴졌음. 애초에 포로로 안잡고 걍 처단했으면 없었을 위기라...
환상수호전의 경우 모든 동료를 모으면 의외의 히든동료가 추가되어 일명 진엔딩같은 요소가 있는데 이게임도 그게 존재함. 근데 이 해당동료가 좀 부실함. 환상수호전의 경우 모르고 플레이할 경우 그 히든동료에서 오는 감동같은게 존재했는데 이 게임은....굳이 얘가 히든일 필요가 있었나 싶음. 합류때 누군가의 죽음도 막아주는데 상황상 솔직히 굳이 얘가 막아줘야 했나 싶을정도로 감동은 없고 개 뜬금없다는 느낌만 들었음. 히든동료가 의외가 아니라 원래 당연히 합류해야 하는 동료인데 각본상 어거지로 막아뒀다는 느낌만 듦.
그 외 분명 스토리상 비중이 꽤 크지만 등장자체가 없는 제국의 황제라던가 하는 소소한 부분에서도 스토리에 마이너스를 줄 부분..dlc에서 제국 스토리도 있다고는 해서 여기서는 나오지 않을까 싶지만 정작 그 dlc가 12월의 절반이 넘은 지금까지도 예고조차 없다는게 불안함.

1.这游戏的建模和图像还好吧，值20块钱。这游戏最多值20块钱，多一分都不要给，剧情和玩法就是一坨狗屎。
2.我家猫看我玩了这游戏，用关爱智障的眼神看了我一会就离家出走了。
3.第二男主和第三女主让你觉得DLC的钱被骗了。
4.设计者一直努力的在做一件事情，就是让你辛辛苦苦的去收集，却开出一坨屎，这种设计贯穿了始终，不知道他们为什么对玩家充满了恶意，随意说两个吧，废了半天劲收到的陀螺小子，毛线用处没有，真心硬憋一个用途，就是不收集齐全了，女爵会死掉。又比如钉宫CV那个梅洛儿，尤其这个梅洛儿，造型可爱，声音好听，数值也好看，还有专属技能，战斗设计的也非常好看，虽然符文格子不如莫莫，但是看面板也应该是前列的人物，结果她的技能根本就是一直MISS嘛，搞不懂这么恶搞目的是什么，莫莫一个光系大魔法全屏都4000，梅洛儿的5SP全屏技能居然次次MISS。还有可爱的莫莫居然是自称老夫的女装大佬，不过这玩意以前看过很多，勉强忍着了吧。话说用巴巴芭看她俩似乎还有点关系，真是恶心透顶了。
5.顺便吐槽下大家的评论，回合制游戏这几年做的都很水，包括旅人1和旅人2，每个都玩了100多小时，言过其实的产品。玩过几十年的回合制游戏，真心不推荐这三款游戏，当然萌新可以玩玩，反正你们也没玩过什么好玩意。

Pros:
- Graphics - character sprites are great and look fine on 3D backgrounds
- Voice acting - decent
- Building your own town and recruiting an army of heroes is an amazing concept

Cons:
- Very basic combat system - auto-battle is the only way to slog through trash mobs
- Random encounters - the old way - popping up from nowhere, enemies can't be seen on the map
- Boss battles - feel too long instead of challenging
- Magic - weaker than melee though you spend mana on it which doesn't replenish on it's own 
- The world map is empty - you run around between towns and dungeons to get random encounters
- Inventory is limited
- No animation speed-up options - everything is rather slow
- Army battles - not properly explained, it feels like "I did something and something happened"
- Duels - the same
- Goal setting for the player - the quests are like "recruit more heroes" - who? where? go figure! - no visual cues or even text descriptions
- Annoying "runaway" sequences when heroes run from somebody and literally every couple of steps there is a cutscene and a fight with the same group of mobs
- Bland protagonist - everyone be like "you're the best, Nowa", making him the captain and the leader of resistance, so even he himself says "Why me?", he doesn't have any personality or cool traits

This game tries to do many things but handles most of them poorly. And it doesn't respect your time and feels really dated game design-wise. I'm pretty sure that the upcoming Suikoden remasters will have much more in terms of QoL.

This game is not even close to being as good as any of the mainline Suikoden games (Suikoden 1-5). I think Rabbit & Bear Studios wanted to create a epic game, but failed to realize it was just to big for them. They should have delayed the game at least 1 or 2 years or released on one platform at a time.

It started with a successful Kickstarter campaign July 27 2020, which grew bigger than expected with several added goals. Rabbit & Bear Studios asked for more money from backers for a companion game and "Backer Hero" title. Rabbit & Bear Studios later partnered with Microsoft for a Gamepass deal. The game was released almost 4 years after the Kickstarter started.

I supported the campaign. So far I only got the companion game, the "Beta" (which was the release version of the game) and the game at release for PS5 & PC with loads of game breaking bugs (same as in the "Beta").
Rabbit and Bear Studios failed the backers in a lot of ways. Some backers did not get game keys, no initial info about very high shipping costs for physical copies, broken promises for backer exclusive things (we have to print the exclusive covers ourselves...), released the game in a very poor state etc. 
Still waiting for the rest of the Backer things I paid for. Latest update from Rabbit & Bear Studios I got (from the Kickstarter project) was Octorber 15 2024.

The graphics is very bad on the highest settings at 3440*1440. Very poor texture quality. Textures range from good to extremely low quality. Poor texture filtering, very close to the character. Lots of character and environmental pop in. Very poor shadow quality, poor shadow  range and sometimes very pixelated shadows. The animations and overall design is ok. Expect graphics similar to a low quality Nintendo Switch game.

Music and overall sound quality is ok, but nothing special.

The story is really bad, with poorly written script. Lots of character, but none is as memorable as the ones from the Suikoden universe. No interesting character back stories or quests that brings life to the cast of characters.

The game tries it's best to mimic the mechanics of Suikoden games. Limitations that were part of the Suikoden games like inventory management feels out of place in a modern game. Somehow they made minigames really frustrating and I rather skip them. Character recruitment is ok most of the time. The HQ is really bad.
The game is a turn based RPG, but for some reason they chose to implement a "gimmick" system. Some battles has a "gimmick", and I think this makes the battles really frustrating and boring. I think that Rabbit & Bear should tune the combat system so it is more balanced (how much damage you/enemies inflict etc). Rune lenses feels like a poorly implemented copy of the runes from Suikoden.

Bugs. Lots of them. The game was unplayable on PC at release. Most bugs has been fixed, but the damage is done. I had to replay the game several times due to bugs. Frame rate was tied to enemy encounter rate, buggy quests, several crashes and other game breaking bugs at release. I reported a bug/issue were the game displays graphics in the black border areas when using a 21:9 monitor. This has not been fixed and happens quite often. I need to restart the game to make the issue disappear.

Rabbit & Bear asks a premium price for this game (50 Euros), but delivers a very low quality RPG experience that is not worth more than 15 Euros. The DLC has not been released yet.

The love for the Suikoden games made me support this game. I regret backing the game, and won't support any games Rabbit & Bear Studios produces in the future. I consider Eiyuden Chronicle: Hundred Heroes to be the worst game released in 2024.

This is easily the most Japanese thing I've ever experienced in my life.  One of the very first characters you can find is a magical girl, who has to *actually explain why that's different from a female mage to the MC*.  One of the various mini-games (which you need to do to recruit yet more characters) is essentially just legally distinct Beyblades.  If the characters treated it like a silly kids' game, I would have been able to 100% it just like any other mini-game... but instead that whole section is like walking onto the set of a completely different anime (complete with brand new over the top hairstyles) the whole way through, and they take it so seriously that I can no longer restrain my cringe.

If you have never seen an anime you didn't like, this will probably be right up your alley.  If there is any aspect of japanese culture you dislike/find cringey/etc., I'd suggest you give this one a pass.  You can guarantee they've found a way to work it in, and give it just enough facetime to kill any enthusiasm you have for the rest of the game.

Eiyuden Chronicle : Hundred Heroes est un très bon JRPG en honneur à ses prédécesseurs et apporte un très bon lot d’activités. Très plaisant à jouer et avec un bon visuel, le jeu prendra beaucoup de votre temps car celui-ci est assez long notamment si vous désirez trouver tous les héros.

Mais ce qui aurait pu être la plus grande force de Eiyuden Chronicle: Hundred Heroes est aussi sa plus grande faiblesse. Avec la quantité de choses à faire, les types de gameplay disponibles et le nombre de héros à recruter, le jeu manque de concentration et d’homogénéité. Il fait très bien ce qu’il fait, mais parfois il ne parvient pas à surmonter ses points négatifs.

Ceux qui, comme moi, aiment vraiment les JRPG classiques y trouveront de quoi se régaler, mais ceux qui n’aiment pas ce genre de jeu ne devraient pas s’en approcher. Si vous êtes un fan de JRPG et surtout si vous avez connu la série Suikoden, je ne peux rien faire d’autre que de vous recommander chaudement ce titre qui s'apprécie comme un véritable bonbon nostalgique. Malgré ses défauts, j’ai pris beaucoup de plaisir à y jouer et j'ai réussi le défi de trouver tous les personnages sans faute ! >> 15/20

Eiyuden Chronicle: Hundred Heroes es un JRPG que rinde homenaje a los clásicos del género, especialmente a la serie Suikoden, al tiempo que introduce elementos frescos y contemporáneos.

Jugabilidad:

El juego ofrece una experiencia tradicional de rol por turnos, enriquecida por la posibilidad de reclutar a más de 100 personajes, cada uno con habilidades y trasfondos únicos. Esta diversidad permite una personalización profunda del equipo y estrategias variadas en combate. Además, la construcción y gestión de una base propia añade una capa adicional de profundidad, incentivando la exploración y la interacción con los personajes.

Inmersión:

La narrativa está cuidadosamente elaborada, presentando una historia que, aunque puede parecer familiar, se desarrolla de manera envolvente. Los personajes están bien definidos y sus interacciones contribuyen a crear un mundo vivo y creíble. El diseño artístico, que combina sprites en 2D con entornos en 3D, evoca una sensación de nostalgia al tiempo que ofrece una estética moderna y atractiva.

Calidad:

El apartado gráfico destaca por su estilo artístico detallado y encantador, que recuerda a los JRPG de antaño pero con un toque contemporáneo. La banda sonora complementa adecuadamente la ambientación del juego, aunque no llega a ser especialmente memorable.

Aspectos Relevantes:

La posibilidad de reclutar a una amplia variedad de personajes y la gestión de la base proporcionan una re-jugabilidad significativa. Sin embargo, algunos jugadores pueden encontrar que ciertas mecánicas resultan repetitivas con el tiempo. Además, aunque la historia es sólida, no introduce innovaciones significativas en el género.

Nota Final

Eiyuden Chronicle: Hundred Heroes es una carta de amor a los JRPG clásicos, ofreciendo una experiencia que satisfará tanto a los veteranos del género como a los nuevos jugadores. Aunque no reinventa la fórmula, ejecuta sus elementos con una calidad y dedicación que merecen reconocimiento.

Calificación: 8.5/10

Um jogo feito para os amantes de RPG. É assim que o título do game nos mostra, eu acho que faltou muito pra ser um jogo para os amantes dos RPGs, vamos lá. 

Prós:
* gráficos pixelados bonitos
* ambientes bem desenhados e bonitos
* mini-jogos até certa forma legais e divertidos
*  variedade de raças de personagnes

contras:

* muito grind pra upar o personagem
* muito grind pra evoluir o castelo(muito mesmo)
* muito grind pra zerar os mini-jogos
* gameplay até legal, só que pouco váriavel
* poucas magias
* boss fights longos demais
* pouca exploração de cenário
* itens equipáveis faz pouca diferença

Resumindo, tinha muito pra ser bom e falhou miseravelmente, não sei o por que desses grinds eternos para conseguir evolução do jogo, ele é bonito, só que cansa muito pra jogar, fiquei meses pra chegar no final do jogo e estou horas no último castelo. Vamos ver se haverá outra tentativa do estúdio de fazer algo melhor pra frente.

This is a love letter to Suikoden 1 and 2.
With that expectation is hard judge this game fairly.
Needs some QoL features. Inventory and gear management is sub-par. The rune (lens) system is.... not great.
Character can be a bit slow and combat drags with animations (how i miss Suikoden character jumping all together to attacks their target.)

Characters a memorable, pace is good. Combat can be hard if you are prepared and impossible if you are not.

Am Anfang leicht skeptisch, ob es denn wirklich Lohnenswert wäre, sich diesem Spiel zu stellen, musste ich mit Erstaunen feststellen, dass es ein wirklich gelungenes RPG ist mit einer guten Story und jede Menge guten Side-Elemente. Nicht nur kann man eine absurde Anzahl an Charaktere freischalten, wobei nicht alle für den Kampf sind, sondern kann sich auch sein eigenes kleines Städtchen bauen und auch mal eben ein wenig mit den NPC’s Karten spielen oder anderen Tätigkeiten nachgehen. Die Grafik ist auch hübsch anzusehen und bringt den Vibe der 90er und 2000er RPG's wieder ein wenig zurück, nur das die Charaktere halt keine Arme aus Quadraten haben ;) . Alles in allem kann ich das Spiel ohne bedenken Empfehle, für alle die RPG's mögen und auch für Leute die mit dem Genre bisher noch nicht soviel zu tun hatten.

全実績取ったので感想。難易度はノーマル。前作の[url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/1658290/_Rising/]百英雄伝 Rising[/url]プレイ済み。

[h1]なんやかんや言われてるけど、結局このゲームどうなのよ？[/h1]
気になっていたけど買わずじまいで半年経過。他の人の感想を見ても良いのか悪いのか分からない。「こうなったら自分でやるしかない！」と思い、セールで購入。世間がロマサガやドラクエ3で盛り上がるなか、私は静かに百英雄伝を始めるのだった…。

[h3]「っとにしょーもねぇ、くだらねぇゲームだな」という部分と「やっぱこれめちゃくちゃ面白いわ…」という部分がハッキリしているゲーム。[/h3]
UIの不便さ、全体的なテンポの悪さを許容できる人にはおすすめできます。最近のゲームに慣れて、色々便利じゃないと我慢ならない人には厳しい。良くも悪くもPS1時代のような部分が多数あるので、そこを受け入れられるかどうかで明暗分かれると思う。

[h3]前作はプレイした方がいいのか？[/h3]
引継ぎの面で見るとやらなくていいです。アイテムが1つもらえるだけ(後でいくらでも購入できる)。ストーリーも繋がっているわけではないので問題無し。
ただ、やった方が世界観とキャラクターへの理解度が深まります。前作から続投するキャラがいるので、ストーリーで登場すると「おっ！」となるし、何より愛着が湧く。
自分はめいっぱい百英雄伝を楽しみたかったので前作をプレイしましたが、やはり間違っていなかった。やって良かったと思っています。

[h3]良い所[/h3]
●HD‐2Dで描かれるグラフィック、幻想水滸伝を彷彿とさせるドット絵のクオリティ
綺麗な背景とドット絵のキャラクターが違和感なく存在している。のどかな村の風景、都会の街の華やかさといった雰囲気を出すのに貢献している。特に水の都ハイシャーンは必見。BGMも相まって非常に美しい街になっている。
ドット絵のクオリティは文句無し。戦闘モーション、立ち姿、移動姿など見ていて楽しい。幻想水滸伝1、2を正当進化させたドット絵と言ってもいいでしょう。主人公3人は斜め方向も描かれている。仕事が細かい。

●物語を彩る膨大な数のキャラクター
やはりここが最大の魅力でしょう。個性豊かなキャラクターが敵味方合わせて100人以上。獣人、エルフ、サメ人など様々な種族も存在しており、冒険を進めてどこで誰と出会うのか？どんなキャラが仲間になるのか？というのが楽しい。幻想水滸伝からの面白さは損なわれていない。
自分は3人目の主人公を初めて操作できるようになった時が印象に残っている。ここで一気に新キャラが6人ほど登場するので「うわー！何かいっぱい出てきた！」「あれ？こいつ前作にいたやつじゃん！」と終始興奮しっぱなしだった。この時のBGM・雰囲気もバッチリでワクワクが止まらなかったのを覚えている。

●BGM
良曲が多いです。ここも文句無し。主人公3人にそれぞれメインテーマが存在するが、どれもキャラに合っていて良い曲になっている。物語の随所に盛り上がる・場面に合った曲が流れるので耳に残りやすい物が多い。

●100人以上の仲間全員にボイスが付いている
フルボイスではないが9割ボイス付き。いまや声が付くことは珍しい事ではないが、敵味方合わせて100人以上のキャラクターに声が割り振られていることは評価されるべきしょう。
担当声優も有名な人が多く、詳しい人なら聞いただけで分かると思う。

●施設の「劇場」が面白い
[h3]このゲームの魅力の4割は「劇場」にあると言っても過言ではない。そのくらい面白いし沼る。[/h3]
ゲームを進めると「劇場」という施設を使用する事ができる。赤ずきん、シンデレラなどの演目を仲間達に演じてもらえるシステムだ。配役は自由に設定できるので、赤ずきん役を荒々しいおっさん、オオカミ役に優しい女の子を配置して演じてもらう事もできる。
ゲームの進行には関係ないお遊び施設なのだが、これの力の入れようが凄まじい。
まず仲間全員がフルボイスで喋ってくれる。どの配役に配置してもフルボイス。演目は5種類。配役は全部で28なのでそれに仲間の数を計算すると、なんと[b]3360種類[/b]のボイスが聞ける事になる。この施設だけでこの数のボイスが収録されているのが凄い。開発陣の熱が分かる。
配役によってキャラの個性が出るのも面白い。
例えばロミオとジュリエット。
真面目なキャラにジュリエット役を任せた場合は、しっかり台本通りに演じてくれる。一方で荒々しいおっさんをジュリエット役にした場合は、台本なんかガン無視で[h3] 「ロミオ～～！！愛してるぜ～～！！」[/h3]という感じでおっさん要素全開で演じてくれる。
100人以上いるキャラクターがこのような個性を持って演じてくれるので、全然飽きない。
「意外とこのキャラ演技上手いな…」「いや棒読みじゃねーか！」という発見があるのでキャラに親しみが持てる。やっぱ声優ってすげーわ。
これはとんでもないコンテンツになってますよ。

●メインストーリーに絡まないキャラの救済
ストーリーの随所でPTメンバーが一言喋ったり、好感度の高いキャラが登場するイベントが用意されていたりと、メインストーリーに絡まないキャラが埋もれないように工夫がされている。

●戦闘中のセリフの多さ
攻撃、クリティカル、被攻撃、被クリティカル、ダウンなどキャラの状況によって様々なセリフを喋る。自分と仲が良いキャラがダウンしたら怒ったり、身代わりとなって守ってくれたらお礼を言うなど細かい。こういう部分がしっかりしてるとキャラに愛着が湧き、このゲームが好きになる。

●演出
ストーリーを盛り上げる演出はしっかりしている。特に一騎打ちのカメラワーク、攻撃の演出など優れており熱い。
3人の主人公それぞれが戦う理由の描写、そして集まり共同で作戦を行っていく姿をみるのは感慨深い。
スタッフロール→英雄達のその後…の流れは、達成感と感動のあまり泣いてしまった。ここまで感情を揺さぶられるとは思わなかった。

[h3]賛否が分かれそうな所[/h3]
●ストーリー
強大な敵に敗れ、力をつけながら逆襲していく王道ストーリーだが、説明不足・都合がいい所があり納得できない部分がある。
[spoiler]・ハイシャーンにいた時のマールリッジの役職がよく分からなかった。学問所の講師という説明があったが、軍人ではなかったのか？軍人でないなら何故作戦会議に参加できていたのか？
・ノールスターで負けて港から脱出する時、シャークマンが助けに来たがそもそも戦いに参戦していなかったのか？【キーナーンの軍勢が間に合わない】という問題で時間稼ぎの作戦をしていたが、シャークマンの軍勢を待たなかったのは何故なのか？
・何故シャークマンの船にユイリンが乗っていたのか？
・本拠地防衛戦の時に巨人が助けに来たが、あまりにも突然すぎる。巨人の存在を示唆するような伏線も無かったと思う。(あったらごめんなさい。)
・アンデッドの存在も謎。何故あのタイミングで急に出現したのかよく分からない。めちゃくちゃ強い勢力が急に登場し、味方陣営を襲っていくので「こいつらは何？」という疑問を抱えてしまう。
・ヒュースバインが脱獄した事について誰も言及していない。地下にいる兵士に話しかけても「異常ありません！」とか言ってる。異常あるだろ！
EDの分岐に関わる重要な事なので、脱獄した事についてもう少し伏線が欲しかった。
[/spoiler]
後半の展開が駆け足。
[spoiler]・本拠地防衛戦から1ヶ月の間に【ヤールナーン奪還】【アスラバート奪還】【ハイシャーン奪還】【帝国の皇帝救出】の4つの出来事が起きている。「奪還に成功しました」「救出に成功しました」という事後報告で片付いてしまうため、プレイヤーがこれらに関わる事は無い。急に状況が一変するので戸惑う。[/spoiler]

●足の遅さ
移動速度を上げる装備品・仲間は存在するが、ゲーム序盤はそんな物ないため足の遅さが目立つ。
特にエルティスワイスは良くない。PT編成、装備の保管所、宿屋が街の左上奥にあるため入口から移動するのに時間が掛かる。ファストトラベルもないので走っていくしかない。
個人的にはこんなものかなと思ったが、人によっては耐えられないかも。

●戦闘バランス
序盤はキツイかなと思う。ホイミのような回復魔法があるのだが、MP90に対して消費MPが10とコストが高いため気軽に使えない。
ただ、しっかりレベルを上げて装備を整えてダンジョンに挑めば攻略は可能になっている。100時間以上やったが全滅は1、2回くらいしかしなかった。

[h3]不満点[/h3]
[h1]●UIが酷すぎる [/h1]
[b]とにかくこの問題について声を大にして言いたい。このゲームはUIが酷すぎる！[/b]
[h2]見づらい
分かりづらい
使いづらい[/h2]
の三拍子揃ってます。

・まずメニュー画面が嫌。
所持品などを確認するためにメニューを開くのだが、項目が

アイテム
魔法
装備
ステータス

という感じの縦の表示ではなく

ヘルプ　←　アイテム　→　魔法　

という横の表示になっている。
このメニューを使っていて

【一度に三つしか項目が表示されないため、目当ての項目がどこにあるのか分かりづらい】
【項目を切り替える時の動きがもっさりしてる】
【ステータスの項目を見たいのに、装備品など他の項目を経由しないと目的の項目に行けないので無駄な時間がかかる】
【直感的に操作がしづらい】

というストレスを感じた。
メニュー画面なんか頻繁に開くのに何故こんな使いづらい物にしたのか？理解に苦しむ。

・倉庫に預けた装備を取り出す時に、ルーン、防具、アクセサリーに分けてソートができない。
名前順、魔法防御順、物理防御順の3パターンしかソートが用意されていない。何故この3パターンだけなのか？HP順、物理攻撃順などがないのは何故なのか？やくそうなどの道具類は種類別に並び替えできるのに何故装備はできないのか？

・倉庫に預けた装備・道具を売る時にソートができない。
倉庫にぶち込んだ順に並べられているだけ。そもそも何故ソートがないのか？意図はなんなのか？何を考えているのか？

・道具を取り出す時、売買する時に何個で1セットなのか分かりづらい。
やくそうは6個で1セット、特上やくそうは4個で1セットと種類で別れているのだが、分かりやすい表示がないので困る。右上に袋の容量が表示されているが、これで計算しろというのは酷な話ではないか？もっと他に方法があったと思うが…。

・まとめて出来ない事が多すぎる。
鑑定屋でまとめて鑑定できない。
鍛冶屋でまとめて鍛えることができない。
ルーンをまとめて買う事ができない。
防具をまとめて買う事ができない。
カード屋でカードパックをまとめて買う事ができない。
倉庫に預ける時に数種類まとめて預けることができない。一種類ずつしか預けられない。
…etc

というようにとにかく不便極まりない。探せばいくらでも問題が見つかる。

[h1]これ本当に令和6年のゲームですか？[/h1]
この状態で発売した事が逆にすごい。

●派遣部隊の融通の利かなさ
ギルドで派遣中の部隊にPT強制参加のキャラがいた場合、問答無用で派遣が中止される。本拠地に戻って再編しなければならない。このためストーリーに関わりそうなメインキャラを派遣部隊に入れるのはリスクが高い。
また、PT編成画面で派遣部隊に所属しているキャラに何の表示もないため、うっかりPTに入れると派遣が中止され再編しなければならなくなる。

●英雄コンボの確認がPTに入れてステータスを見るしか方法が無い
キャラの英雄コンボを確認したい時は、いちいちPTに入れてメニューを開いてステータスを見て確認するしかない。なぜPT編成の画面で確認ができないのか？

●一騎打ちの説明が無い
チュートリアルはおろかヘルプにもない。何の説明もなしに突然戦いが始まる。幻想水滸伝のような3すくみではなく、攻撃と防御しかないため過去の知識で戦おうにも勝手が違う。
全く勝てないので敗北イベントだと思ってた。

●宿屋で休んだ時に同行者、控えメンバーが回復しない
控えメンバーが回復しないのは百歩譲って分かる。だが同行者が回復しないのは明らかにおかしい。宿屋に泊まってないって事？同行者なのに？

●同行者への不満
このゲームは同行者の扱いが悪いです。体力は回復しない、ステータスは見れない、冒険の途中でPTメンバーと交代できない(宿屋に行かないと編成できない)、装備してるアクセサリーの効果が適応されない、装備をいじれない、戦闘が終わっても経験値をもらえないなど不遇。PTに同行してるのに。
せめてアクセサリーの効果が適応されたら足が遅い問題、アクセサリー枠問題は解決すると思うんだけど。

●倉庫に預ける事ができる場所が1ヶ所しかない
本拠地の倉庫係に話しかけないと持ち物を預けることができない。他の方法はない。なので持ち物が増えてきたら本拠地に帰る必要があるのだが、その往復が面倒。
特に序盤～中盤は持ち運べる数が少ないので、足が遅い問題と相まって往復するのが鬱陶しく感じる。
便利すぎかもしれないが、各地の宿屋で物を預けられる事ができたらよかったかも。

[h3]ミニゲームについて[/h3]
このゲームには6種類のミニゲームが存在しており、実績や仲間集めと関係がある。しっかりイベントをこなさないと仲間が加入しないミニゲームもあるので疎かにはできない。

●釣り
世界各地に存在する釣りスポットを巡り、大物を釣り上げよう！

ルールはどうぶつの森形式。ブイが沈んだらボタンを押す。前作の[url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/1658290/_Rising/]Rising[/url]とやり方が変わった。
[h3]恐らく一番影が薄いミニゲーム[/h3]
・釣りポイントに桟橋がある場所と無い場所があり、無い場所の発見が困難。

難しくはないが面白いわけでもない。しかし、釣りポイントを見かけるとついつい竿を垂らしてしまう。不思議な魅力を持ったミニゲーム。

●シャークシップレース
レースに参加してライバルとタイムを競おう。目指せランキング1位！

船を操作してタイムを競うレースゲーム。ミニゲームの中で唯一技術が求められる。
[h2]面白くないです[/h2]
・船の操作性が悪すぎて思うように操れない。
・レース中にコースが表示されない
・難易度最上級がかなり難しい

という欠点があり、レースゲームに慣れていない人には全くおすすめできません。とにかく操作性が悪すぎて話にならない。
運よく最上級コースで1位になり実績は取れましたが二度とやりたくないです。
やればやるほどこのゲームが嫌いになるでしょう。

●ベーゴマバトル
黄金の回転を求める熱きベーゴマ戦士達の物語。最強のベーゴマ戦士になり自分だけの回転を見つけよう！

ベーゴマを集めてライバルを倒していくミニゲーム。長尺のイベントが用意されており、それを完遂しないと加入しない仲間がいる。
[h3]そこまで悪くない[/h3]
ベーゴマの種類は60種類。モンスターのドロップで入手できるので、気長に戦闘しながら集めたほうがいい。
イベントはホビーアニメのノリと雰囲気で進むので、そういう感じで楽しめばいいと思う。

・イベントが思ったよりも長い
・2ラウンド先取した・されたのに3ラウンド目が始まる。時間の無駄でしかない。
・序盤はベーゴマが弱いので誰にも勝てない可能性が高い。
・倒したベーゴマ戦士と倒してないベーゴマ戦士の区別がつかない

上記の問題点はあるがそこまで悪くない。だが面白いわけでもない。

●カードバトル
160枚のカードからデッキを組んで英雄達と勝負しよう。いざ、デュエルスタート！

様々な効果を持った160枚のカードの中から36枚選び、デッキを組んで英雄達と戦うミニゲーム。
[h3]個人的にミニゲームの中で一番面白い[/h3]
デュエル中の相手のセリフが多く用意されており、状況に応じて喋ってくれる。ルールは簡単なのでカードゲームが苦手な人でも勝てるはず。

・相手が弱すぎる。歯ごたえがない。
・カットインが多すぎてテンポが悪い
・デュエルを途中でやめることができない。サレンダーできない。
・実績を狙う場合は長い苦行が待っている。[spoiler]対戦相手120人倒す[/spoiler]

しっかりしたゲーム性を求めるとアレだが、ミニゲームとして見るといい出来だと思う。キャラクターが色々喋ってくれるのがやはり嬉しい。

●エッグフットレース
仲間のエッグフットとレースで勝負！交配を繰り返して最強のエッグフットを産み出そう！

エッグフットというモンスターを育ててレースに挑戦する育成ゲーム。レースは見守る事しかできない。交配を繰り返すことでエッグフットが強化され、足が速くなったり頭が良くなったりする。
[h2]断トツで面白くない。ミニゲームの中で一番嫌いです。[/h2]
・エッグフットの卵をまとめて預けることができない
・卵の孵化の演出を飛ばす事ができない。まとめて孵化をさせることができない。
・エッグフットをまとめて引退させる事ができない。引退の演出を飛ばす事ができない。
・レース自体のテンポが悪い。変化が少ない。同じ事の繰り返し。
・仲間が自分のエッグフットをレースに参戦させる事があるが、1人しか参加しないので寂しい。6レーンあるんだからもっと参加させるべき。
・レース実況者のボキャブラリーが貧弱。同じ事しか言わないので飽きる。そもそもレースの実況をするために仲間になったのに、ボキャブラリーが貧弱ってどういう事？

兎にも角にもUIが酷いので、面白い・面白くない以前にやる気にならない。本当に嫌。

●料理対決
料理で世界征服を企む闇竜料理会と勝負をしよう。料理人は料理でしか語れない…ゆえに勝負は料理でつけるのだ！

料理界の闇を支配する闇竜料理会というなんだかよく分からん組織との対決を描くミニゲーム。こちらも長いイベントが用意されており、仲間を加入させるには進める必要がある。
[h3]良い所はある。だが長すぎる[/h3]
・レシピの表示がバラバラで前菜、メイン、デザートの料理が分かりづらい。カテゴリー別に分けるべき。
・連打が必要なのが気に入らない。
・料理時間が長い。45秒もいらない。25秒くらいでいい。
・レシピ集めが地獄。低確率でショップに並ぶとか誰が考えたの？悪魔のアイデア。

仲間の審査員コメント、スト―リー、ドット絵の料理など面白い部分はある。だが、ちょっとイベントが長すぎるかな…。

It's difficult to talk about Eiyuden Chronicle without mentioning Suikoden, the series to which it's paying homage - it's even harder for me as I love Suikoden with every fiber of my being - but I'll try.

A JRPG throwback to the Playstation 1 and 2 era, Eiyuden Chronicle: Hundred Heroes is a competent RPG with some excellent visuals, very nice music, a load of gameplay systems and mini-games to engage with, and a few areas that could really use some improvement.

To start with the game's strengths, the basic mechanics of the game are pretty darn solid and combat is quick and punchy and generally a lot of fun.  There's a ton of characters to recruit and a castle town to build up as a home base, both of which are very engaging.  There's also a tactical combat system for army level combat and while fairly basic it does a good job of feeling like a large battle.  Finally, the visuals and sounds work very well: there's some excellent sprite work and phenomenal character design (especially given the number of characters present).  The music is quite good, though I wish there were a few more tracks to add more variety, and though the localization and voice acting have seen a mixed reception, I think they work well and are enjoyable.

Despite all the positives, the Eiyuden Chronicle does fall into a few pitfalls.  The area that I think hurts the game the most is its pacing (that nemesis of many a JRPG); parts of the game overstay their welcome and draw things out unnecessarily.  Though there are a large number of minigames to try out, they're a very mixed bag and I didn't care for most of them.  There's also a dueling combat mode that infrequently shows up, and while the visual spectacle of those fights is wonderful, they were often confusing and unpleasant to play.

Despite its flaws, I did really enjoy my time with Eiyuden Chronicle and am glad I played through it.  I can easily recommend the game to fans of the genre.  It's a bit longer than it probably needed to be but the good stuff here far outweighs the bad.

I'll be honest I nearly tanked this review because they made me redo the two phase final boss fight due to a duel system directly afterwards that involves 3 characters I didn't have leveled so I died no matter what and had to grind them up to lv60 before doing it again... yet, I want to give this game a positive review due to the sheer amount of effort and positive notes throughout the title. Here's a more in-depth look:

[b]Positives[/b]
[list]
    [*]Fully voiced! With 100 party members and even more NPCs: that's a lot of work.
    [*]Speaking of fully voiced: you can unlock a theater that lets every party member voice every role. For example: you get several scripts and one is Cinderella. All 100 members can voice each role including the fairy god mother, prince, sisters, etc. Nothing is off limits and you even get some easter eggs depending on the role and member. It's an immense amount of work to get this many voice actors but FURTHER ask them to deliver every line from every role in every script possible in the game's theater. It's impressive.
    [*]100 party members and a good portion are usable. We'll talk about what went wrong here later.
    [*]Just an absolute avalanche of side content and mini-games. Not limited to: Beyblade storyline, 15 iron chef showdowns, GWENT/Marvel Snap card game, desert ship racing, a full chocobo breeding and racing-like, combat trials, and probably some I've somehow forgotten. This doesn't include the cavalry battles during war (hard to fail) and the dueling system (explained below as a frustration).
    [*]Cute little city building aspect 1/3 of the way through the game.
    [*]The combat is fine. SP system means you'll gun for characters with AoE SP moves so you can horde your mana. In fact early game magic use is just not viable at all due to the high costs of magic (1 AoE spell costs like 55 and your characters will barely have 100MP for awhile).
[/list]

[b]Needs Work[/b]
[list]
    [*]No button remapping.
    [*]No way to enable/disable auto-text scroll mid conversation.
    [*]The duel system is awful and, as noted above, can completely brick content if you haven't leveled the participating party members enough. The audio cues aren't sufficient and even the clashes often left me wondering if I did something right.
    [*]Desert ship racing controls are nonsense if using the joystick. Stick to the D-pad.
    [*]The inventory limit is nearly constantly suffocating. Even worse: there's only one person in one part of the map throughout the entirety of the game you can store items with. It's surprisingly not in every town or at every inn.
    [*]Storage/selling interface is divorced from how it appears in your inventory which is a constant struggle. You have 17 herbs? Were they in stacks of 4 or 6? Better exit out entirely to find out.
    [*]The battle plan system for auto battles mostly works but isn't as intuitive as it needs to be. I never did figure out how to get one of my party members to use his 3 SP party-wide attack buff.
    [*]3 units in the game take two slots of your 6 (3 in front, 3 in back) and they are just plain never worth it. Too often you get units taken away, need units to open chests, need units to participate in battle gimmicks... and if a large unit dies: both back units behind them are brought to the front.
    [*]In the middle of the game you'll have to create 3 entire parties to do a few sequences. This never comes back and is largely a waste of your time unless you use the combat trials.
    [*]Attack range is nonsensical. It mostly serves as a barricade for units with short reach to not be able to attack from the back without specific equipment. Doesn't really seem like a worthwhile addition to the game's combat.
    [*]One of the recruitable party members requires you to make a trading profit of 50k. You get no hard indicator of how much you've earned, but instead have to keep traveling to him to see how far along you are. I spent hours dealing with this until I looked it up and was completely blinded by the red/blue arrows on goods. Never go by these. A region with double blue arrowed-diamonds could still net you a profit selling in a region with double red arrowed-diamonds. In other words its the prices you need to pay attention to and no one is going to do that when traveling between 8 trading hubs.
    [*]When playing Beigoma (Beyblades): you're forced to finish the 3rd round even if you've won or lost both previous rounds. Beigoma is also just nonsense to play and strategize against. I didn't bother finishing this minigame.
    [*]The cooking battles could be a bit snappier and require less mashing. I don't like destroying my wrist in-between battles just to find that the judges that said they like sweet things hated the ice cream I served.
    [*]Time mechanics in general in this game are way too inflated. Shops restock every 30 IRL minutes and considering they have secret shop items that are required to build certain buildings: you'll be save scumming often just to get a script that should have just been sold there at all times. You also have lengthy waits for earning town resources/money/guild missions which will most likely have you keeping the game on overnight because you need 500 sacred tree chips.
    [*]Again there's no reason for secret shop items to exist on a 30min timer. They should be there at all times.
    [*]Can't skip cut scenes.
    [*]Saving is unreliable. Are you in a 45min sequence and have to go to a doctor's appointment soon? Sorry no save points also the auto save didn't feel like proccing. In fact there are more reliable saves in dungeons than towns. You can only save wherever the inn is in a town and there are no overworld saves.
    [*]The main villain is boring. The story is overall serviceable but never gets past, "bad guy wants things, will take it from you".
    [*]100 party members and a giant chunk of them aren't viable. Sure lots of them have different stats and rune slot types, but if they have no unique SP move or defense gimmick: they're destined for the storage box.
[/list]

破台之後感覺還是挺好的，可實在有太多地方可以進行優化跟改良，不管是系統還是劇情或各種轉場銜接，但我想..這算是一款好遊戲吧。

講講優點
1.劇情就是王道性質，整體上主要人物塑造跟故事性還是很有趣
2.各種附加小遊戲，其中以卡牌遊戲最有娛樂性
3.同時也是主要賣點:擁有非常多的夥伴們等你收集，支援夥伴也帶來各種不同的附加效果
4.家園系統，慢慢收集材料來升級自己的家園並加以裝飾

缺點
1.符文系統不夠平衡，爛的角色就是爛
2.各種細節優化太差，非常浪費時間又沒什意義，比如武器強化過場時間過久、存檔點只能在特定點上儲存、角色更換符文更換應該要更便利才對。
3.戰爭系統沒什麼策略性可言
4.特定商品出現時間，若是通過某個條件後才開放購買那還合理，每20分鐘刷新一次才有機會出現是怎樣? 根本就是在浪費時間，重點是你等的也不是什麼特別的裝備還是好東西，只是個道具而已...有事嗎這設計
5.也是我最賭蘭的一點，料理大賽漫長又無趣，該快速過場的不能跳過，料理比賽也就是探討喜好大賽而已，還給我設置贏16場才可以拿到某個角色，為了收集這角色浪費一堆時間，空白鍵按有一萬下了，這根本就是在折磨玩家吧?

結論：遊戲各方面都很有潛力，一定可以做得更好，
但各種該琢磨的系統跟細節卻又很北爛，如果沒有耐心的玩家真不推薦入坑。

[h1][b][u]Eiyuden Chronicle.[/u][/b][/h1]

[b][i]J'avais beaucoup d’attentes autour de ce jeu, mais j’étais tout de même prêt à être déçu. Même si le jeu offre une aventure relativement sympathique, il lui manque une petite étincelle.[/i][/b]


[b][i]Viseullement[/i][/b] je trouve le jeu assez joli, mais j'ai évidemment une grosse préférence pour les sprits en pixel des personnages. En effet, le reste du jeu en 3D et la plupart des monstres n'ont absolument pas la même aura que les personnages. Ils sont fadent et rappel le design des jeux mobiles. De plus, certains décors nuisent à la lisibilité du terrain, au point qu’il est difficile de s’orienter sans la mini-map.
Le cycle jour/nuit et les transitions météo laissent à désirer. Sur la mappemonde, il fait toujours beau, mais cela n'empêche pas le jeu de faire des transitions brutales entre jour et nuit lors de certains événements en ville. Ça casse un peu l’immersion et c’est dommage.

Concernant les [b][i]combats[/i][/b] et plus précisément le [b][i]Système de Tactique[/i][/b] qui permet de définir le comportement des personnages en mode automatique, il est simplement nul. Il est par exemple impossible d’empêcher un personnage d’utiliser sa magie sans le rendre totalement inutile en combat. Les [b][i]PM[/i][/b] étant une ressource assez limitée, j'aurais aimé pouvoir empêcher mes personnages de les dépenser bêtement lors de l'activation du mode tactique, mais cela les rend presque inutiles. Bref, le paramétrage est trop limité et vraiment pas clair.
Les [b][i]animations[/i][/b] en combat sont jolies, bien qu'elles ne soient finalement pas si nombreuses.
Enfin d'autres détails quelque peu irritants comme la résurrection, puisqu'il est impossible de viser un personnage mort autrement qu'avec un sort ou un objet de résurrection, ce qui nous empêche de planifier un soin directement après. Les ennemis, eux, n'en ont que faire et se feront un plaisir de tuer en boucle un personnage tout juste réanimé. Une aberration selon moi.

le [b][i]Système d'XP[/i][/b] est mauvais puisqu'on ne peut pas réellement [b][i]"farmer"[/i][/b]de niveaux. L’[b][i]XP[/i][/b] est largement conditionnée par le jeu lui-même, résultat, on passe beaucoup de temps à fuir les combats, puisqu'ils finissent rapidement par ne plus donner suffisamment d'[b][i]XP[/i][/b]. Un système franchement frustrant.

Les combats de [b][i]Champs de Bataille[/i][/b] sont eux aussi d'une incroyable médiocrité, je ne vois pas qui peut prendre du plaisir dans ce type de contenu, il n'y a quasiment rien a faire et le rendu général est incroyablement fade.

Les [b][i]mini-jeux[/i][/b] sont vraiment nuls, et je pèse mes mots. Le mini-jeu de toupies, le [b][i]Beigoma[/i][/b] est tout simplement nul à chiər, tandis que le jeu de cartes est lent. Les deux jeux sont accès sur la puissance de vos toupies qu'il faudra [b][i]loot[/i][/b] ou de vos cartes qu'ils faudra acheter. Le seul skill nécessaire étant de savoir spammer le même bouton. Le summum de l'amusement.

La [b][i]traduction[/i][/b] laisse vraiment à désirer. Entre les erreurs de dialogue flagrantes et les incohérences comme un personnage demandant 500 000 pièces pour être recruté, mais qui finalement se recrute pour 100 000, on se demande si la trad a été correctement relu.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3365651916

[b][i]Ce que Eiyuden Chronicle arrive à faire de mieux, c'est finalement un visuel globalement sympathique bien qu'inégale ainsi que de très jolis animations de personnage lors des combats. L'histoire s'en sort elle aussi convenablement, même si elle n'a rien d'incroyable pour autant.
Malgré ça et quelques bons moments, Eiyuden Chronicle est tout de même une petite déception qui m'interroge sur la licence Suikoden, que je n'ai jamais eu l'occasion de faire. Quoi qu'il en soit, si vous aimez les JRPG, vous passerez à n'en point douter un bon moment.[/i][/b]

If you're a Suikoden fan, then you'll feel right at home with this. Everything about this game seems meant to carry the Suikoden DNA and they pull it off quite well. All of the staples are here with 120 heroes, your own alliance headquarters and some mini-games to boot. (Things like a Yu-Gi-Oh! styled card game, a Beyblade knock-off and some eggfoot monster racing!) The art direction mixes a simple yet charming 3D world with 2D sprites. It almost gave me Ragnarok Online vibes at times. The story might not be quite as deep as something like Suikoden II, but it's decent enough to provide you with reasons to build your army. As with any game that throws a million characters your way, you won't find yourself connecting with the majority of heroes you'll collect as there's simply not enough time or story for each of them. The game provides you with some backstory on each character that you can read if you're willing to grind the money required to unlock their backgrounds, but you'll most likely find a small team you prefer and stick with them throughout all the story beats. The game will force specific characters on you at times, but it also provides you with a method of bringing those heroes along as "attendants" without forcing them in your fighting group. Overall, I really enjoyed the throwback nostalgia that Eiyuden Chronicle provided here and would easily recommend this to any classic JRPG or Suikoden fan. Full disclosure, I did not play Eiyuden Chronicle: Rising before this despite some of the characters crossing over into this game. That game did not hold the same appeal to me. Enjoy!

このゲームは【幻想水滸伝】というゲームに魅入られ、その亡霊を追い求めている亡者向けのゲームである。
（なので一応オススメを押した）
ので、幻水を知らない新規のユーザーにはただの古臭いRPGに見えると思われます。
ただ、幻水の亡者だからといってこのゲームが令和に蘇った幻想水滸伝であるかといえば、その出力は60％程度。期待していたものの「コレジャナイ」感は否めない。

・戦闘バランス、テンポ
　協力攻撃前提のバランスのため、いちいち演出を見なくてはいけないのがテンポ悪い。
　魔法の消費MPがえげつない（ボス戦以外でMP使えないレベル）
　ろくな魔法がない（使える魔法はごく一部のみ）
　味方キャラのあからさまな強弱…は元からあったからいいか

・キャラクター
　主人公は特筆すべき不幸な過去もなくただ人が良いおせっかいな世話焼きというキャラ付けなのだが、幻水シリーズのように抗えない運命に巻き込まれるという展開もないのでなんでこの戦争のためにここまで尽くせるのか理解ができない…みたいになる。幻水シリーズと違って普通に喋るので何を考えているのかわかるのだが、喋ってもなんで君がここまでしなきゃならないんだっていうのが一切わからなかった…喋らないほうがよかったのでは…？
　他キャラもキャラ付けやキャラデザの濃淡は様々だが平成感というのが良くも悪くも目立つ…
　ただ、事前に百英雄伝 RisingをやっていたおかげでRising組には愛着があった。

　主人公の一人であるメリサが主人公たり得なかったのがもったいない。正直ノアとセイの間に入り込めてない。重要キャラの一人で良かった気がする。一人だけ言ってることが違う。

・ストーリー
　ラスボスにあたる悪役の小物感が気になった。
　というよりも、紋章に比べて魔導レンズの設定が薄い…使いすぎると世界に良くないとかもないんか…Risingであんなに意味深だったのに…
　全体的に薄味なのは軍師キャラが薄味なせいもありそう。

・ミニゲーム
　カードバトルもベーゴマもごくごく薄味のつまらないバトルなのに（カードはましかな）やり込まないと仲間にならないキャラがいるのが苦痛。せめて途中で仲間入りしてほしかった…。
　料理対決はほぼほぼ幻水２のそれなのに連打しないといけないせいで一気にやろうとするとコントローラーが心配になるレベルで連打要求がある。幻水２の料理対決は本当に面白かった記憶があるのにこっちはやらされてる感…料理で仲間になるキャラもほぼ最後までやらないといけないので義務感が出る…。
　戦争パートもほぼ駒を移動させるだけのものなのに演出が長くてダルい。幻水３や５の戦争もダルかったが、あれとは違う意味でダルい。戦死がない（ないよね？）ので緊張感もない。
　幻水３であんなに好きだった演劇だがキャラに魅力がいまいちないせいで１度もやらずにクリアした…他のミニゲームがあっさり終わるなら手をつけていたかもしれないだけに残念…。
　ミニゲーム系は総じて残念な出来。むしろメインストーリーを阻害する要素すらあるのが悲しい。ミニゲーム由来の仲間集めのせいで10時間くらいもっていかれるのは解せんポイントが一番高い。

・音楽
　BGMは総じてクオリティの高いのだが、ゲームにあっているかといえばそこまであっていない。もったいない…。
　単体で聴いたらいい曲揃い。


以上のように「幻水２を目指してしまったがために超えられなかった」感がめちゃくちゃあるのが残念。
ただ、これは！と思ったのが一騎打ちの演出が素晴らしかった（一騎打ちのシステムはいつものじゃんけんじゃないのでいまいちなのは置いといて）
一騎打ちすべてに特殊な演出がはいるので盛り上がったのは大変良かったです。

次回のために謎を残しているようだが、次回作があるなら幻想水滸伝という呪縛から枷を解き放ってほしいと思いました。

Going to review this as someone who has never played the Suikoden series. I saw their Kickstarter campaign and waited years to play this.

It is most definitely a love letter to JRPG fans. The tropes, the characters, the grind. If you're an avid fan of classic JRPGs, you'll feel right at home and the typical pain points for most people such as a one dimensional story of good versus evil won't really bother you.

Things I liked:

- Coming from Octopath Traveler, I really loved how they combined the 2D sprites with 3D elements. I'm not saying it's out of this world, but what I am saying I found myself admiring the scenery and combat sequences a lot, especially during the duels.

- Classic JRPG music and motifs. I found myself dozing off in Hishahn (Eiyuden's Japanese themed city) because of the visuals and music.

- There are so many side activities and easter eggs. The card game was surprisingly fun with its own booster packs for you to collect cards. Anyone who has listened to Yu-Gi-Oh! in Japanese will love the voice acting. The beigona (their version of Beyblade) was interesting, but outside of the obvious anime references, it fell a little short for me. Of course there's a racing mini-game here and while the gimmick is fun, I can't really say I enjoyed it because I lagged badly. I love games that allow you build a base camp or town that grows over time as the story develops and you can do that here, too! There's even a little shokugeki action.

- Combat is ENJOYABLE and there is a lot of depth. With 120 recruitable characters and different battle mechanics, you can really customize your dream team. With the attendant feature, you don't even have to keep the main character in the main party. There's also army combat, which is basically a chessboard auto-battler. It was enjoyable, but I think it'll turn off a lot of players.

Things I disliked:

- With so many recruitable characters, gear management is atrocious. No way to sort through them easily. Leveling their weapons to max is painful, but I guess I shoulda been doing it as I played.

- The lens and runes system really felt lackluster, imho. Some characters are limited by how many runes they can use and I would've the ability to expand that with an expensive or hard-to-get item. Also again with so many recruitable characters, the rune management system is ATROCIOUS, too.

- Maybe I missed it, maybe it's not there, but I expected there to be secret bosses or hidden items because it's a love letter to JRPG fans. There were a couple, but not enough to warrant exploration.

- You have 120 recruitable characters. You have 6 in the main party, 1 for support, and 3 for attendants. After you upgrade everything, you can send a max of 3 teams of 5 to go gather materials. Why are there not more options for idle characters to participate? Surely, they can go fish? Do guard duty? Maybe station them at certain stations for bonuses or discounts? Just seems like a giant waste. 

I don't know if it's a $50 tag to be honest, but it offers enough of a novelty experience that I enjoyed it and don't regret it buying it. I feel like with how many things this game can do, the modding scene could have a payday with it.

After playing Unicorn Overlord, Triangle Strategy and multiple Fire Emblems, I was looking for something similar with Eiyuden.

The game has a few turn offs:
- The vibes/characters feel very quirky/goofy, like something from Toriyama (Dragon Ball). Might be up your alley if you like that, but I'd rather have a dramatic story front and center.
- Locations feel empty, just kinda big gamey Persona style corridors and big rectangles. I got almost nothing from exploring the overworld map or the first towns
- Random encounters. They are such an outdated concept. They make me feel punished for exploring
- In the first dungeon they give you 5 people who basically spam attack and a healer who's out of mana after one group heal with no items to restore MP
- 6 unit party combat right from the start got old fast. Like I said, you basically spam attack with all of them and input commands give a slight delay on the UI, so it feels muddy. I was already looking for an option to skip animations, but there is none.

Starting up the game feels like I'm in for a chore right now. I'd honestly give it back if I could, maybe I'll give it another chance after trying out Metaphor.

Compra obligada si eres fan de Suikoden y los jrpg

当游戏最后所有参与众筹的人员名单滚过的时候，我很难分辨对这款游戏的感觉是喜欢还是讨厌更多一些。这款诞生于玩家众筹的《百英雄传》作为《幻想水浒传》系列的精神续作，非常原汁原味的继承了那些传统JRPG的风味，即使很多部分以现在的眼光来看都显得非常难以接受，
- 比如非常丰富但无聊的小游戏体系（陀螺和蛋蛋兽两个系统能玩下去的真是神人了，竞速赛的操纵根本就是反人类，厨艺大赛根本就是看脸，唯一值得一玩的大概就是卡牌？但是要打120把真的也很无聊）
- 比如非常不智能的战斗系统（真的会因为疯狂踩地雷而抓狂），比如意义不明的单挑和合战系统（真的不好玩！）
- 比如现代游戏里很多基础的功能竟然都是游戏的一部分要随着游戏慢慢解锁？（前期不能传送全靠走，队伍不能随便换人，状态回复非常困难）
这里的每一项都在劝退现在的玩家。但是你又能很明显的感受到制作组对于这款游戏的诚意
+超级精美的画面
+悦耳动听的BGM
+丰富的登场人物。（收集120名角色的过程真的很快乐，而且每个角色都有单独的人物小传和后日谈，但很可惜大多数角色的形象并不够立体，如果能有多一些的支线任务或者故事就更完美了）
+游戏也梗了很多的其他游戏/动漫.(陀螺战士上来那一段真的很神奇宝贝，打牌的感觉和游戏王也太像了，还有那个如假包换的城之内）
我不推荐你们去玩这个游戏，但我觉得你们都值得买这个游戏
他们还是他们，只是时代变了

Nostalgic RPG
妥妥的半成品，游戏体验十分糟糕，拖沓的剧情，无趣的回合制战斗，百英雄就是凑数硬加进去的，很多角色根本就用不上也没特色，还有各种各样的小问题比如不支持鼠标操控，钓鱼点太隐蔽，关键道具不特殊说明导致出售后无法招募新英雄等等，也就剩游戏画面比较精美这点优点了，除了幻想水浒传的情怀党外不推荐购买，玩了不到30小时一肚子气，真不值这个价格。

对这款游戏期待比较高，但玩下来有点失望，不过也不是不能玩，总体给个7分吧

先说优点：
像素动画真的顶级，人物动作丰富流畅，战斗的画面表现力也是可圈可点，尤其是单挑战的动画，简直帅得一塌糊涂
角色人设也做的还可以，日语声优质量很高，很多角色虽然一次没用过也能让人有点印象
游戏比那种无脑升级堆数值的RPG有深度，要考虑到角色特性和符文搭配，虽然一眼望去感觉是有最优解，但至少要研究研究

优点就这些了，剩下都是缺点：
1 剧情弱智：
故事背景搞的很宏大，讲出来就变成了中学生过家家，故事发展一眼望到头，人物行为全程不合逻辑，台词通篇说教非常空洞，情绪没有感染力，但凡带点脑子看就想骂人
2 演出拖沓
游戏进行中动不动就黑屏切演出，举个例子有个机关，你走过去就黑屏切演出开始对话，
“这里有个机关” “是做什么的呢？” “按一下试试吧” “哇动了” “我们走吧” “嗯”
就这种又臭又长且完全没有意义的信息，真的没必要用黑屏演出表现出来
还有战斗的演出也是，刚开始玩的时候还好，时间久了多少都会看腻，如果能加个战斗演出加速的按钮体验会好很多
3 流程设计不合理
前期可以一直带一队打，但中后期的时候突然要求你把角色分三队各自去打不同的boss，如果其他角色没练就会非常折磨

4 折磨的小游戏
本作添加了很多小游戏，基本都很敷衍，除了卡牌之外其他都没什么策略性，并且演出全都又臭又长，尤其是厨艺大赛要狂点45秒的A键，想收相关的角色你还要强制玩15次，胜负结果还非常随机，这种设计是人能想出来的？还有那个单挑战，纯纯的意义不明，画面挺帅的，但玩起来主打一个折磨，纯纯就石头剪刀布，动画还不能快进，死了就得重头来，真的建议删掉单挑战的操作部分，直接播片就行

暂时就想到这么多，其实游戏里很多点子的立意都很好，可惜没做明白，如果丰富一下9分完全没问题，只能说可惜了，希望2代能改进一下，希望还能有2代

Translation/localization is fine.  It's not Persona 4 quality -- few games are -- but its better than a lot of other JRPGs.  I was expecting a trainwreck, but I've come to the conclusion that the people yelling about it in the comments are weird chud gamers angry about political stuff in a game that unavoidably has to be about politics.  The Suikoden series is about wars, refugees, various cultures and ideologies mixing -- like an entire subplot in Suikoden 2 revolves around Twin River's racist reaction to Winger refugees and how they're not inherently bad, but driven to criminality and shit due to living in poverty.  I'm sure they would have called that "woke" twenty years ago.

The actual writing is better than the old Suikoden games, but the tone is definitely the same.  There's occasional zany shit happening, but that also happened in the old games, just occasional adies into hijinks and goofball characters.  

Some of the complaints feel disingenuous, almost like they're arguing for a more literal translation, but very literal translations are awful.  Like the reason Persona 5's translation is noticeably worse than Persona 4's is because 5's is frequently way too literal instead of a proper localization, which often robs the characters of a voice or makes everything feel very dry.  Or think of Legend of Dragoon: cool game, technically a good story, but the writing is stilted and lifeless because its a slavishly literal, snore inducing translation.

If you like the Suikoden series, especially 1 and 2, or just classic RPGs, then the game is worth a buy.  Voice acting so far is a little hit or miss, but with such a large cast that's to be expected -- though nothing has been outright terrible, a couple characters are a bit meh.

One of the rare games I backed on Kickstarter some time ago is a the spiritual successor to the cult classic Suikoden games, made by their original designer. In Eiyuden, we play as Nova, a newcomer in the local law-keeping organization/mercenary guild. Soon, events rapidly escalate, intertwining ancient magical (or perhaps not-so-magical) technologies, political intrigues, and war. Unintentionally, we find ourselves leading this guild, responsible for recruiting new members, developing our base, and planning operations. It would have been a bit more believable if Nova had any kind of charisma, but he usually comes across as an awkward and rather compliant young man.

However, the game isn’t just about Nova—there’s no shortage of characters of all kinds, each with their own quirk. They say that if you gather them all, you can unlock a happier ending, but I didn’t make it that far. The characters are quite appealing, though I would’ve preferred if instead of 120 of them, there were half as many, with each getting twice as much screen time. Still, they have enough charm to make you care about them and see them as real people rather than nameless units.

The combat system is moderately interesting, combining tactical planning with auto-battle. We select 6 characters who stand in two rows—front and back—just like the enemies (except for bosses). Then, we choose actions for all the fighters at once, and the round plays out automatically. Different actions/skills can move our fighters up or down on the initiative scale. On one hand, this system allows for planning, but often the lack of direct control makes it impossible to efficiently use healing (since enemy targets are unknown) or area attacks, leading to wasted actions. The game has a full auto-battle option, and honestly, on normal difficulty, most fights are easy to get through without any commands from me.

Base building is fun, but more because of the satisfaction of upgrading than the actual gameplay—gather resources, choose an upgrade, done. The game has many mini-games, but none of them turned out to be particularly interesting—at least for me. On top of that, some of them require random drops just to play.

So, what’s the verdict? Unfortunately, the attempt to create a serious political story didn’t work, but I wasn’t really expecting it to. It’s a missed opportunity, but one that's easy to overlook. Ultimately, it’s impossible not to see the soul and love with which this game was made, and it’s hard not to feel warm feelings toward the characters, so the game succeeds in its goal.

Con aprox 80 hs de juego, estoy en el tramo final. El juego es MUY bueno !

Lo jugué de manera casual siguiendo alguna guía de reclutamiento solamente en dos momentos del juego (casi no son missable, así que no hace falta mirar mucho hasta cerca del final).

Han hecho un trabajo excelente con Eiyuden Chronicle, no sólo capta a la perfección el encanto tradicional de los JRPG, sino que introduce algunos conceptos muy interesantes !

Lo positivo:

- Jugabilidad amigable: el juego es fácil de retomar después de un par de días, no te deja perdido, pero también te abre un poco a explorar de vez en cuando.
- Visuales hermosas: el pixel art de los personajes es bellísimo y el 3D del entorno excelente, ambos se mezclan de forma perfecta
- Buenas dinámicas: hay una buena variedad de personajes, tramas y paisajes durante el juego, aunque sí se mantiene un tono bastante ligero, no es un juego oscuro.
- Buen sistema de combate: el combate es entretenido, aunque parte de ello es la cantidad de personajes y runas, podría mejorarse en algunos aspectos. Hay buenos efectos y animaciones.
- Muchísimo contenido ! Reclutar personajes, pescar, jugar a las cartas, beigomas, entrenar tus personajes para derrotar todos los dungeons y enemigos, desarrollar tu HQ, decorar tu habitación, etc., hay muchísimo por hacer !

Ahora, lo malo:

- La historia es interesante, pero podría mejorar. Se sintió una buena falta de desarrollo de personaje y conexión entre los tres principales, además de que faltó un poco más de oscuridad y profundidad.
- Los duelos 1-1 son hermosos, pero las mecánicas son raras y casi no se hacen duelos en todo el juego
- La mayoría de personajes tienen sólo 1 habilidad, casi ninguna puede hacer crítico y los combos son mayormente inútiles; es decir, los personajes son demasiado genéricos en cuanto a batallas.

Un detalle que puede ser bueno o malo según lo veas, es que en este juego prácticamente no se puede overlevelear, y a su vez también se reduce mucho la necesidad de grindear; de la forma que está hecho, tus personajes rápida y fácilmente llegan al nivel que deben tener, pero no tienen casi posibilidad de volverse OP (la hay, pero requiere entender algunas cosas, y sólo podes hacerlo pegando un salto grande, no podes subir de a pasos pequeños).

En general, un 8.5/10 por mi parte, y especialmente me gustaría ver un Eiyuden Chronicle 2, mejorando sobre los aspectos que mencioné (especialmente las habilidades !)

Most of this game is not designed around making sure you're having fun, it's designed around making sure you spend more time to do something.  Puzzles aren't puzzles, they're just an excuse for you to have to back track all over the same dungeon multiple times.  It can take hours to recruit a single character that is just a random side character that you'll never actually play, but if you don't recruit all the characters, there are negative impacts for the story.  Some characters take a painful amount of time to recruit by playing cooking mini games (literally just pick the food the judges will like best), the card mini game, which to be fair is actually a real mini game, and the spinning top mini game (may they reserve a special place in hell for whoever decided to put this in the game).

The story is about as lazy as it gets.  If you've seen a Saturday morning cartoon hero/villain, you know exactly what to expect.  The game also forces multiple annoying things on you and forces you to decide which one you'd like to address.  You get a "support" character that provides passive buffs.  One will let you walk faster which can help the tediousness of back tracking.  One will let you adjust your party at save points in a dungeon if you realize you're composition isn't great or you've exhausted a character's MP so you don't have to go back to town.  But you only get 1 support character, so you have to pick which quality of life you want.  It's not like it makes the game easier or harder, it's just asking which pointless time sink you're going to eliminate and which one you're going to keep.

Then there is the RNG.  Some boss fights have mechanics where basically you have to guess on a 50/50 how to interact.  Other fights (duels) will have predetermined responses you're supposed to make depending on the dialog but the dialog isn't a hint at what to choose, so you either pick randomly and take notes on the correct responses or you just look up the answers, neither is fun.

There is some fun to be had, but overall it seems like the goal was "We want the player to spend 60 hours on this game" when it should be "We want the player to always enjoy what they're experiencing".  If you decide to play the game, just remember when you start playing Beigoma...you were warned!

The Bad:
The Story: The Story is not interesting, there is not enough depth and feels like the story is written by an elementary schooler. No Twist and so predictable.
The 108 heros: There are many heroes with almost no background and usefullness whatsoever just to fulfill the 108 quota, you get some strange useless heroes that suddenly joins with no clear background or motives.

ストーリーの都合で編成必須キャラがいるのは良いのだが、その画面で装備の付け替えができない。
ダッシュブーツやグロウバッチなどの必要なアクセサリーや防具の回収や付け直しが都度そのキャラのパーティーに入れなくてはならない為手間でしかない。
そもそもアクセサリーに関してはグロウリングはともかく、ダッシュブーツをわざわざ装備させる必要があるのか？スタリオンみたいなキャラを期待していたし、そのためにステアップなどをつけられないのがストレス。

またメニュー画面に関してもタブの切り替え等が全体的に遅い割に、選択式ではなく一つずつ切り替えのため目的のページにいくまでに無駄に時間をとられてしまう。

肝心のストーリーも言葉選びや会話の順序（特にリーンの居場所の件）、状況描写（気を失う程の高所落下なのに怪我に関しての話がない、何故焚火？、村の右手に抜けていったのに合流した先に村が見える(これに関してはそういうルートを選定した可能性はあるが)。）などで違和感が多く、また村人たちにも急に英語の名前の人がいたりして没入感がいまいちない。
多種族多文明とあるが序盤で特に説明もないためカタカナでの名づけで差別化できなかったのか？

ルーンもSPはともかくMPが効果と使用量見合っているか？と思ってしまうし、英雄コンボも序盤では全体ならともかく敵1体のみが対象なら打つメリットがないようにも感じる。

あと地味にストレスなのが一秒移動してまたイベント戦闘みたいなの多すぎない？それなら全部イベント進行で複数戦闘挟むとかじゃダメなの？都度回復とかするためにしてもその都度切り替えの暗転挟むのがなぁという感じ。

I previously played this to the end on Switch, but am replaying now on Steam since I am a sucker for achievements in games like this, and Nintendo doesn't do those. 

There are some gripes, like how a few of the minigames were implemented, and that there are many of the 120 recruitable characters who really don't have any depth or expansion beyond when you meet and/or recruit them. I wish there was more mass combat, for example, and that the controls in the sandsail races weren't so janky. But by and large, this the best JRPG to come out in years. 

I can't wait for the sequel.

Some thoughts after playing Eiyuden after 25 hrs:

Summary: All in all, I think they played it too safe in creating this game. Honestly I would have liked if they made bolder or riskier decisions and more mature storyline but I kinda understand because of what’s on the line with this first game and new studio. Expecting more if there’s a sequel. And still a decent game all things considered. With Murayama gone (RIP), really curious what’s the future of the series will look like.

Detailed thoughts:
Background: I played Suikoden 1-5 a lot and know it like the back of my hand. Can recruit 108 characters and do the true ending without looking a guided even after all these years. So with that out of the way, here are my thoughts.

This is a decent JRPG game. But falls short since it’s supposed to be a Suikoden successor. Might be better than Suikoden 1 (arguable) but can’t live up to Suikoden 2 and 5.


Some gameplay thoughts:
1. Changes the Suikoden rune system to Rune Lenses. Kinda nice. MP and system are nice too but the random SP during encounters make me rage. Why is it random?
2. I love that there are at least various weapon types and it’s not all physical damage. Kudos to this. 
3. I don’t like that they removed the party formation system from Suikoden 5. And only 1 support member? And can’t freely move party in entourage. Changing party members in inns are nice tho.
4. Teleport system is way better. I miss Viki tho. :(
5. I hate the war gameplay so much specially when I compare it to 2 and even to 5.
6. I hate the treasure chest gimmick battles as a completionist.
7. World map seems way smaller? Since they’re segmented to smaller areas.
8. Almost third person POV is still throwing me off, I still prefer top down.

[spoiler] Storyline thoughts as of 25hrs:

1. Nowa is likeable but I feel like we should spent more time with him at the start. Should have shown Leene at the start instead at the middle of the story too. Players lack connection with him vs when compared to Riou, Tir, or Frey.
2. Same with the main supporting cast, players lack connection with Lian, Mio and Garr. I feel like I’m more connected with CJ, Isha and Garou because of Rising. They made us connect more in 1 and 2 with Viktor and Flik and with the Queen’s Knight in 5.
3. I’m not as invested in the fall of Grum County when compared to fall of Sol-Falena or fall of Muse. 
4. Nowa is not a “chosen one” when compared to the protagonists of Suikoden series. Like why would people follow him? He’s likeable but I feel like there’s nothing special
5. And there’s no story with the castle? If there is, must be in the faded books and it sucks.
6. Seign joined too early.
7. Dux Aldric is “Luca Blight at home”
8. Mentioned it in the gameplay but the world map is segmented by mountains and it’s just weird.

ストーリークリア、仲間キャラ120人集めてTrueEnd見たので書きます
まず全体の総評として
・ストーリー　7/10点
・キャラクター　8/10点
・UI　0/10点
・ミニゲーム　0/10点
・ゲームバランス　0/10点
の合計50点満点中の15点の神ゲー作品です（僕はもう二度とプレイしません）

まずストーリーについては王道のストーリーなのでこれについては基準点以上、もう少し主人公とかのキャラ深堀出来ていれば8点あげてもいいくらいの出来でした

キャラクターに関しては120名それぞれ個性を持ったキャラクターで確実に自分の好きなキャラクターが見つけられ、お気に入りでパーティー作ったりと色々強さ以外の補正もあるように感じたのでこの点数です

UIに関しては「終わってる」の一言
このゲームファストトラベルはあるキャラクターを仲間にするとできるようになるのですが、毎回このファストトラベルの最中そのキャラクターの芝居に付き合って音声ボイスが再生されます
ファストトラベルの時「毎回」言われます
これがどれくらいうざいのかはプレイしてたプレイヤーだとすぐにわかるでしょう
今すぐアップデートして消せ
その他もステータスやアイテム画面のUIは独特、タブを移動にもドット絵にも関わらず体感できるくらい時間がかかって遅い
ルーンの着脱もメニュー画面で行えずルーン屋か本拠地でしか変えられない
ストーリー中盤から後半に鑑定アイテム入手しての鑑定に一斉鑑定がない
毎回糞みたいなドラムの音で1個1個鑑定するのがもう苦痛でしょうがない
その他皆さんが上げてくれるのがいっぱいあるのですが自分が苦痛に感じたのはここらです

続いてミニゲームに関しては作ってるやつは絶対サイコパスが作ってます
ベーゴマ、料理対決、カード、エッグフットレース、シャークレース
全てがつまらない　よくこんなつまんないミニゲーム量産できるなと感心するレベル
仲間を120人集めるのにベーゴマと料理対決は必須なのですがこの2つがマジでミニゲームとして終わってます
ベーゴマに関しては強いベーゴマを持ってる相手に下位のベーゴマで勝つことはかなり厳しく、結局強いベーゴマを手に入れるストーリー終盤までは手を出せませんし、そのベーゴマのミニゲーム自体もマジで面白みの何もないただのクソゲー
料理対決は卵料理3品目で勝てるバグが修正されましたが修正されなくても正直よかったってくらい運ゲーです
おそらく修正が入り、ストーリー後半で手に入るレシピには他キャラの好みの補正が数多く入ってるっぽく万人受けにするようになっていて、初期料理レシピと比べて明らかに高得点が取れる仕様に変更になってるように感じました
でも審査員の味の好みが全てで5人全員バラバラだと点数が伸びないので本当に運ゲーです
審査員の味の好みが全て似通っていればある程度高得点を出せる料理は作れるのですがそれは相手も一緒
相手は自分が持ってないレシピを使って料理してくるのでそれが最高点を叩き出せる審査員の組み合わせの場合絶対勝てません
それを勝つまで永遠にボタン連打させられます　何が楽しくてこのミニゲーム作ったの？
それにボタン連打もストーリー後半で手に入るレシピになればなるほど連打量が加速度的に増えていきます
かろうじてマシだったのがカードくらいでこれはプレイじゃなく種類を揃えるほうだったのが残念ですね
今すぐにでも料理かベーゴマと変えてほしいレベルです

最後にゲームバランス
一番最初に気づくかもしれませんがルーンの消費ＭＰ量がバグりちらかしていて終わってます
敵1体攻撃する魔法攻撃でＭＰ最低値「１５」もいります　威力は通常攻撃よりかろうじて強いくらい
流石に消費ＭＰちゃんと見返した？ってレベルで魔法の威力も消費ＭＰも終わりすぎててバランスが悪いとしか言いようがありません結局ボスでしかちゃんとＭＰが使えないってどんだけ縛らせる気ですか？
一番使うのが水の魔法防御底上げとＭＰ40で使えるベホマラーくらいで、終盤に男の娘が入ると上位の魔法を使って1撃で敵を殲滅できるくらいでそれ以外は本当にボス戦で使ったかな？ってくらい影が薄い
結局プレイヤーは燃費のいいスキルキャラを多く入れた編成に偏ってしまうし何のためにルーン作ったのかなといわれてもおかしくない
それに英雄コンボも終わり散らかしていて、最初のチュートリアルで教えてもらって敵全体にダメージは使えるなと思いましたがその他の英雄コンボが2～6人のキャラクターの行動とSPを使って打つようなものがほとんどないのです
英雄コンボ使うくらいなら各キャラクター独自に攻撃やSP使ったほうが伸びる場合が多く正直もっと威力を上げたり全体化させて良かったレベル
キャラクターで強さの差が出てくるのはご愛敬なので最強パーティーか自分好みパーティーでやるかはその人次第なのであえてキャラ差についてはいいませんが、絶望的なくらい不遇なキャラと優遇されてる強キャラ感はあります

[h1]Final Score 8/10[/h1] 

 I was in the market for a new classic JRPG experience to sink a bunch of time into when I came across some previews/reviews of this game. I've never played the Suikoden series, of which this game is apparently a spiritual successor to, but what I saw when looking into this title intrigued me nonetheless. As someone who has been playing RPGs since years that started with "19" I found myself pleasantly surprised by what the developers put together in this gem. So much so that I decided to 100% the game, and enjoyed almost every minute of it. I'm not trying to type a full novel, so I'll highlight a few of the important things that I feel should be mentioned for anyone else that is like I was, and just looking for a fun JRPG adventure to dump 50+ hours into. 

-[b]The game features a large cast of playable characters[/b], some of which are genuinely fun to have in your party and develop strategies around as you make your way through the game. There is ONE character, however, that I found more annoying than anything else. Not in the way she plays during combat, but she's one of the first characters you get moving through the story and she plays a big part in a lot of the story conversations as you play through. It's not enough to ruin the whole experience, though.

-[b]The story is fine for what it is[/b]. I don't want to venture too much into spoiler territory on this one, but suffice it to say that it's the typical unlikely hero and his merry band of misfits against an evil threat which has it's sight on world domination. It's not bad, but it's not great either. I still thoroughly enjoyed working my way through the story despite multiple cliches, so this shouldn't detract someone from purchasing the game. Something this game does a little different than most is the inclusion of 3 main characters, the ones you see on the box art. You still mainly play as Nowa, who I guess you'd call the "main" main character, but the other two play significantly larger roles than the other 100+ playable characters you meet throughout the game. I enjoyed working through their respective storylines as the greater story unfolded. Nowa himself is kind of milk toast and not super interesting, but the rest of the cast more than makes up for it in my opinion

-[b]If you like old school JRPG turn-based combat, you'll feel right at home here[/b].  The front row/back row/attack distance mechanic is a cool little twist from what you see in most turn-based RPGs, and offers itself well to some solid party composition planning. 

-[b]Game runs great on Steam Deck[/b]. Ultimately this was one of the deciding factors for me. I was in the market for a new game that I could play on Steam Deck since I had a few lengthy trips coming up, and this game ran perfectly. It's listed as "Playable" but it runs as well as any "Verified" game I have in my library. One minor annoyance though is when you play on Steam Deck and then go back to playing on your PC, you will have to swap the screen resolution back to whatever your monitor supports. It'll just default to the Deck's lower resolution until you change it. Again, it's a minor annoyance that takes an extra 3 seconds of your time on the start screen and shouldn't detract anyone from purchasing the game, in my opinion. 

-[b]The game's greatest strength lies in the over 100 playable characters you can recruit[/b], each of which has their own strengths and weaknesses to whatever type of party makeup you want to make. Some of them are better than others, but overall it's awesome to have the sheer amount of options this game gives you. Admittedly, I was using a guide on my playthrough to make sure I didn't miss any as I made my way through the game, and there were certainly a few that I would have missed had I not done so. It's worth the time to look into how to get each and every one before the end because [spoiler]you can only get the game's absolute best party member by collecting all 119 or so other characters before a certain pivotal point near the end of the game[/spoiler].

-[b]The game's biggest problem is that it tries to match that old school JRPG goodness to a fault sometimes[/b]. Most notably for me was the sheer lack of a fast travel option until maybe a little before the halfway point in the game. There's a ton of backtracking before you finally unlock the character that allows you to warp from any previously visited towns and such, so getting to that point can be a slog. Those that make it through the early portions of the game without some of the quality-of-life enhancements that modern games provide will find a thoroughly enjoyable adventure once the rest of the world opens up and you can freely warp around to accomplish whatever side quests you've built up along the way.

まず思ったのは、これコナミの幻想水滸伝じゃないのか？ということ。

などと共通点が多い。

あと戦闘難易度が妙に高い。
戦闘難易度がノーマルでも、ザコ戦闘終了時に紙装甲キャラが戦闘不能になっているくらいのバランス。
通常戦闘なのに素早いザコ敵が全体攻撃を連発してあっという間にパーティが壊滅状態で唖然としたのは記憶に新しい。
一番防御が高いキャラでもザコの通常攻撃を集中されると瀕死になるくらいだから、そりゃ紙装甲なら戦闘不能になるのは当たり前と思った次第。
防御主体のキャラが被ダメージ1桁でも、紙防御のキャラが1回受けると瀕死とかどんな調整をしてるのだろうか。

ステータスの物理防御や魔法防御の数値が被ダメージに相当影響するらしく、数値が10も違えば受けるダメージは25くらいは違う。
物理防御が低いキャラには最優先で装備を買い換えないと耐えきれない（正確には換えても耐えきれない）ので注意が必要。
薬草を沢山持って、防御の高いキャラを６人編成した方が戦闘し易いとか正直困る。
何しろストーリー的に編成に必須なキャラが紙防御だと通常戦闘で戦闘不能になってイライラする。
それでも一応、編成必須キャラを戦闘に参加しない同行者に配置できるのは配慮といえるのか？
でも同行者はレベルが上がらない・・・
レベルが上がると紙装甲の後衛もザコ敵の攻撃を耐えられるようになってくるので、レベル上げが非常に重要な要素になっていると感じた。

戦闘バランスに対して色々と愚痴ってしまったが、要するに近年のヌルゲーにどっぷり首まで浸かっている人には向かないゲーム。

まぁでもシナリオは面白いからおすすめ。






戦闘が無傷で簡単に終わってしまうと物足りなくなってしまうのは毒されているのだろうか・・・

Great Game, and a fan of Suikoden. 

Can you make the skills like Searing blast from Nowa and Lightning rush move from Seign SP BASED! 

Magic cast be MP based? 

Can you?

I really wanted to like it, as a fan of previous Suikoden games.

And this could be considered a great game, if it had come out in 2000.

Less than 3 hours in, it crashed my entire computer, not even CTD, mind you. That's something I've only managed before on 500+ modded SkyrimVR.

The lack of modern QoL is astounding. I could probably make it to the fridge and back with a snack in the amount of time it takes just to get out of town from the first HQ. If there's recruit tracking for this huge roster, I haven't found it. And I appreciate not having the map greyed out until I walk there, especially since walking is so slow (made better by an item you have to sacrifice equip slots for though, wtf).

Menu time is abysmal, and lacking a memory function, which is important when there's nearly 10 tabs and each one takes a second and a half to switch through. Want the tab that's farthest away? that'll be 9 seconds everytime you need to access it. Accidentally closed the menu on yourself again because the switch inputs vary screen to screen, have fun getting back to where you were for the third time. Any fast forward feature for the auto-battle option that's included? Nope! Just sitting through the same 5 enemy groups whether it's your first time against them or fiftieth. Want a less confusing Battle Plan for your auto-battles? (Laughs in Hidden)

Got sleepy mid dungeon? Suck it! Can't turn off the game, you have to make it to a save point, because the auto-save can leave you hours behind of where you are. That's a bad match when your game can crash a whole system.

Someone found an item dupe exploit? Patch it! What about the awful drift issue that you've known about since beta that makes the game unplayable without directly changing the deadzone settings in Steam? LEAVE IT IN!!

All that aside, I do plan on finishing the game, since I'm running low on creature collectors I haven't played to death. But even at the sale price of $35, it's been more frustration than enjoyment. If you can pick it up for under $15, I'd say go for it. Then you too can find out that you've got controller drift that you didn't even know existed beforehand.

优缺点都十分明显的游戏。饱满的剧情、丰富的养成系统等等老幻想水浒传的优点都完整的继承了。同时，也继承了一切上世纪90年代至本世纪初的日式RPG糟粕，对，一切糟粕。超大的搞心态迷宫+地雷遇敌+战斗资源限制+强制的线性剧情+低级拖延的解密。这几样捆绑出现，最终导致你迷宫辛苦记好的路，在你最不想战斗的时候，把你拖进一场耗时的战斗中，打完之后，你忘了刚才要怎么走了。我就是那个年代过来的人，这套系统在当时就折磨我很久。但是考虑当年的游戏环境、硬件性能，这种模式是普遍的。而放到今天，开发者特意从万年粪坑当中为玩家掏出这几坨屎强行喂你，我就表示很费解。别的都好说，大迷宫+地雷遇敌模式真的很好吗？讲传统？FF系列不比你传统，糟粕该弃就要弃，特意掏粪喂人的人，没人会夸你勤劳，只会骂你缺心眼。有潜力100分的游戏，生生搞成了59分。本来可以61分的，女主又是个ZZZQ的产物，弄个老黑，服了。最后补充一点，存档的不自由，其实这个算不上什么槽点，很多游戏都存档不自由。但是这个游戏过于不自由，一个大迷宫里天天地雷战，想着急吃饭、出门，硬是找不到存档点，直接退游戏吧，几个小时白打了，呵呵呵呵。这就是这游戏的天才设计。

I will start by saying that I have never played the Suikoden series and I hadn't even heard of it until I read reviews of this game. I (believe) I am half way done with the main story line at the time of this review. With that being said I feel like this game is getting a bad wrap bc most of the negative reviews are comparisons to suikoden 2. Eiyuden Chronicle: Hundred Heroes is a fantastic game! It very much feels like old school jrpgs but with modern QoL features and mechanics. 

Not having played Suikoden 2 I will say that the gameplay of ECHH feels very fresh and fast paced with a WIDE variety of characters to build the perfect team you feel works for you. The world feels very vast and backtracking is rewarded with new discoveries that are worth the extra time. Combat expression feels wonderful with magic, skills, and runes that make most characters feel very unique. 

The story does take a little while to get going as this is most definitely a story focused on the main character and cast. There is the classic backdrop of a medieval fantasy opera but the story is more about the growth of Nowa and his rise to power and his relationships with the people he meets along his journey. 
 The few gripes I have with ECHH is that it did take about 20hrs before fast travel was unlocked but after that the game REALLY opens up. 
There are also basic features that the game fails to explain or makes difficult to understand. (Basic stat attributes are never explained anywhere in the game and you will have to look up what each one does)
Lastly while there are roughly ~120 playable party members, the wide cast does leave VERY little room to get to know each one of them. Most are forget about outside of their introduction (outside of the main cast) and how they can help run things around your base. 
All in all ECHH is a wonderful game and is a must try by any JRPG lover
