This game lasts for about 40/50h depending on how you approach it the first time, overall it took me 54h, in hard, to complete my first run without rushing or being too slow. Writing this at 58h after 3 days and once i had some thought over it.

[b]TLDR:[/b] As of now, the Steam reviews are from 72% to 78% positive and that's a pretty good evaluation range about the game quality. If you want to play a classic JRPG, this is well above the standard idie JRPG that you can find, so play it!
In my opinion the correct price is about 40€, but i took it full price and if you want you can w/o being a lot sad about it.

[list]
 [*][b]Story[/b]: It's a good story but the problem is that for about 2/3 of the game you don't feel the sense of despair they would have wanted you to feel, so that's a negative sadly.
The last 1/3 of the game tho, that becomes really good, and unexpected things happen! You can feel they've been working more on the last part of the game, both the dungeons and the story are done VERY well!

If you see someone review the story with a low score is not because it's actually very bad, it's only because it could have been great and not just good, the game world and lore has a lot of potential but it's not being used much... that's why people are "angry" with this game, so you can rest assured it's nice.

[*][b]Characters[/b]: They're ok, nothing special all across the board. The main villain is sadly not very thorough for most of the game and the character with some personality are about 6/8 out of 120 and you won't have feeling to go and dig their past for their lore because they're not really deep enough.
The main character which you play is like that too, you feel like he's there just because he got in the mix and doesn't take much decisions nor move on his own much, you can feel that he's almost forced by everyone around him to do the correct moral thing...
So the characters are mediocre and nothing else. Some are funny and some are there to fill a slot.

 [*][b]Combat[/b]: The game is not that hard and it's the classic turn-based JRPG with 6 characters on the field, the balance tho has a small problem... Unless you're playing in Normal, you'll feel that some characters are WAY stronger than others.
Personaly i would have liked if the defence of the characters were almost all in the same range, that way you can play whoever you want, but if you play in hard the weak ones will take way too much damage to be usable w/o overlevelling the enemys a lot.
Regarding the difficulty i would suggest you to play at hard for 99% of players. It's not actually that much hard after the first phase of the game and i've actually had to watch out against certain bosses.

 [*][b]Minigames[/b]: They feel like they are randomly placed in the game but 1 or 2 (which are ok), some like them and some don't.
I didn't play them much, i just tried them, but you'll have to see yourself if you are into them. They are not the core of the game tho so you can skip the minigames and still feel good about the game.

 [*][b]Music[/b]: There we are, the music is great throught the whole game, and during the last part they are as 9/10 as you can immagine, with the last one being simply AMAZING. Had to go to youtube for that one again!
[/list]

Overall i think the game would have liked being worked on for at least 1 or 1 and half years more, but let's remember that this game is still an indie project.

There are some annoying things here and there but nothing that will decrease the value of the game by a lot (one of them is in a part of the story, there are cutscenes of characters talking then, once it ends, you take 2 steps and another cutscene starts for like 5 times in a row... bad design but not the end of the world).

Sadly Murayama is not here with us anymore (he's also the creator of Suikoden 1 & 2) but i've heard that he wrote the script for Suikoden 2 before the 1 (hence why S2 is a better game than S1 from what i heard) so i hope he did the same thing with Eiyuden Chronicle: Hundred Heroes. Im gonna play the sequel either way and i hope they can make it a solid successor!

作为一个玩了幻水2不下十遍的玩家，来说下通关后的感受（横向对比幻水2）。另我选的是繁体，人名可能有些出入。（有些剧透，慎入）
首先，我是把百英雄传当做是幻水2的精神续作来玩的，在游戏中也能找到很多致敬幻水2的地方，比如地雷式遇怪，怪物无血条等等，但玩下来还是有一些遗憾的感觉，果然还是期待幻水2能够重置。
音乐方面：作为一个JRPG的爱好者，音乐在我心中的地位与剧情不相上下。可能有些情怀方面加分的原因，幻水2的音乐给我的感觉非常棒，但百英雄传的音乐感觉有些平淡，并且大部分的城镇的bgm居然是一样的（可能制作组在偷懒），而幻水2的城镇bgm几乎都不一样（印象中只有天驼那几个镇子的bgm一样）。通关之后只记得最终迷宫的bgm，以及战旗时的bgm，给我身临其境的感觉。总的来说，音乐方面差强人意。
剧情方面：传统的王道剧情，没有顺风顺水，也有濒临绝境的时候，起伏感很强，尤其是在初次去胖胖国王那里的时候，压迫感比较足；还有肯南叛变的时候，也有一种无力感。不过北星的将军怎么逃出来的感觉有些谜，还有北星的国王，剧情中看到他本人的表现，和从他人那里听说的表现，感觉就是两个人。结局也比较圆满，少了些意难平，缺点是很难让人印象深刻。
人物方面：与幻水2的“哑巴式”主角不同，本作的主角有很多台词，不再是让玩家自行带入，能感受到鲜明的主角形象。幻水2的主角就给我一种闷闷的弱弱的感觉。而其他人物的刻画方面，加尔是好大哥，有点维克多的感觉，莲的感觉像是七美，但女主又不是她。女主的性格比较鲜明，人物刻画也不错，但是最终战的晚上居然是蛋壳妹来找我表白，本人理解不能，我也只是玩了一个小时左右的蛋蛋兽而已，也没刻意去关注这方面。主要是剧情上胖胖国王喜欢女主，我本来想成全他们来着，感觉有点硬加了个感情线，但是又没完全加（怎么有点轨迹的感觉）。比较可惜的是军师，一开始的自私让我对他无感，不由得想起幻水2的修，真的是非常完美的角色，而四眼仔缺少了一些感觉，虽说也体现了点“人尽其用”。之后是另外两位主角，先来说说赛恩，贯彻了自己的正义之路，也有一段与主角针锋相对的时期，但最终实现了自我内心的成长，相比之下，乔伊的经历就很让人心痛，因为命运的安排必须与主角刀剑相向，尤其是普通结局时还用生命来赎罪。第三位主角黑妹没啥感觉，有点女版的男主之感，也是家乡被攻，之后复仇。游戏的强度方面，三位主角中期有点鸡肋的感觉，赛恩平砍伤害低，黑妹也差不多，完全不想练，然后后面居然有他们的单挑环节，直接寄，寄了还要重新打一遍boss，甚至我还要出去重新给他们练级，非常难受。而幻水2中期刷到回刀纹章球之后，主角就差不多开始发力，等到能用倍返之后那就是物理狂人。本作的诺瓦全体火焰伤害感人，八连砍的动画又比较慢，开局不太适应（虽然后面看习惯了也还行，并且配上双战士符文后，还挺期待伤害数字的），得等到50级左右，发挥出符文孔的优势才变得强大。反派方面，公爵的罪恶程度比不上卢卡兄，卢卡是贯彻了自己的邪恶意志，而公爵就感觉缺了点什么，前面一切尽在掌握，后面就一个忠实的仆人，面具女感觉是他雇佣来的，也不靠谱；查贝斯就是个逗比，跟劳德队长不相上下的那种，菜就回家种田，别来丢人现眼了。反派这边感觉没几个人，也就兵力多。而幻水2里面的反派，干掉一个还有一个，以前玩日文版的时候觉得索洛基的发型很帅，但很好奇他后面去哪了（玩了繁中版才知道他挂了），后期又蹦出萨萨雷、尤巴、西尔巴巴古等反派；而本作就那么几个。
战斗系统：本作加入了sp的限制，虽然不太懂战斗开始时给几点sp（感觉完全随机，1~4都可能），要是想攒着不用，下一次战斗开始你会发现少了几点，后来我就直接用了。本作没有直接前后换位的选项，要是开展前忘记调位置，把武器是S的放在了后排，那他就是一局的冷板凳，好不容易打完了又忘记调了（悲）。合体攻击加入了sp的限制，有些不爽，并且好像不会自动放合体技，还得手动，太麻烦了。取消了幻水2中的多次行动（即一个人一次最多可以出手3次），并且平砍的话很多时候都是一个人砍完了，另一个人再开始砍，明明砍的不是同一个人，不能一起冲上去砍吗。。最搞笑的是异常状态，眩晕状态头顶弄个标识很难吗，打晕了的人你要是没注意到被攻击时出现“眩晕”二字，你完全不知道他晕了（如晕），还有诅咒状态（我觉得应该叫这个名字）也是，没有一点标识。除了眩晕有字提示，别的完全没有，要靠你硬猜，挺无语的。最无语的还是战斗完之后，异常状态就好了，我一周目没有吃过一次解异常的药，就占格子用了。（感觉数值策划是小学生，这个等会集中吐槽）一般中毒的话一回合也就掉一点点血，我相信大多数人都会选择直接强撸掉，等到打完了再吃药，结果战斗结束就好了，不得不感叹他们身体的免疫系统。符文也有等级区别，但是孔也有要求。有了+15%的，但是因为大部分是2孔，只能装+10%的，就很难受。而且光的3-5级居然没有攻击，还不如带1-3级的。另外本作最强魔法没有之一：世界的拒绝（所有人免疫攻击一次），多吃点蓝药就能保证每回合都开，虽然本作难度不大也没必要，而且后期帝国兵会掉能够直接使用的符文碎片道具，所有人都能用，多带点的话直接平推任何boss（无尽塔还没怎么打，不做评价），挺无语的。战斗演出挺不错，但是符文的动画过于简单，没有幻水2的最强魔法带感（点名授权者的标志，那种战争的恢弘感和史诗感，一下就出来了）
数值方面：本作最让我难以言语的东西！真的是太愚蠢了，数值策划真的是一直在拉坨大的。前期MP，完全不敢用，当然也可以理解为提高游戏难度，还挺有攻克难关的感觉的。自动战斗的时候，居然会使用符文碎片，我第一次拿到三个碎片，结果下一场战斗就全给他们用完了，我甚至还以为他们是学会了新技能（悲），要想避免这种情况，小队作战只能全程开着“节约资源”，那我想问其他的选项是用来干什么的。睡一次觉1800，后面3000多，这是什么五星级酒店吗，幻水2一个人几十到100多，最多也不超过1000.前期MP满的情况下我不如去买草药回血，还睡个什么觉，要么把宿屋睡觉功能去了，只留主城一个免费的睡觉场所。还有武器强化系统，加满了要么40攻，要么80多是吧，（我只强化了几个人的，可能其他人会不一样），而幻水2几乎每个角色的数值提升都不太一样，本作就我目前看到的两种，感觉数字就是随便填的，完全没有强化武器的欲望，就是个聊胜于无的东西（诺瓦：我差你那40点攻击？）食物我看到回复10点生命，怎么敢的呀？有必要去做吗？最终6人战的boss，跟个睿智一样，明明是最终boss，确只能行动一次，太尼玛搞笑了，世界的拒绝，启动！甚至2回合直接干掉，而且感觉第二形态没有第一形态血多。主城升级的材料数量感觉一般，没有特别烂，虽然有几个的数量需求也很难绷得住。（我直接挂机交给远征队的好兄弟）数值方面的问题感觉就这么多，其他的暂时想不起来了。
战旗：策略性没有幻水2强，感觉就是无脑平推，开开技能直接干，最烦的就是最多只能3个部队进到1格，挺无语的，而且后面几场战斗，都没有能回血的技能用，不知道怎么调队伍才行（虽然回血技能我感觉在本作里面很变态，大大降低了难度）。而幻水2的战旗游戏我就很喜欢玩，尤其是最后一战，一个一个无伤打过去，那感觉太棒了。
小游戏：卡牌我愿称之为本作最佳小游戏，策略性拉满，可惜戏份太少，我收了人就懒得继续玩了。然后蛋蛋兽感觉也没什么玩的必要。之后就是令我究极无比蛋疼的小游戏——陀螺。首先一开始没有陀螺的时候，谜语人就出现了：你没有陀螺吗？我就想说我有nm的陀螺。居然到了中期才解锁，行。然后一上来就是蛋疼的三选一，我哪知道哪个好？算了随便选一个，勉勉强强打过去。之后去找npc玩，赢不了一点，属性克制是看不懂的，加速条的增加速度是不知道的，我只知道预判对面要使用加速技能的时候我也一起看，就可以利用手柄自带的连发功能不讲武德（虽然没必要，游戏的接受频率跟你的输入频率不匹配，按得太快了也没用，手按也差不多），而这也是唯一可以跨等级挑战的资本。然后我就等后期在乌龟背上拿到的强力三星陀螺才去收的利德（就尼玛离谱，本作最难收的人没有之一，还要喂你吃坨大的才能收），然后被告知要做陀螺支线，然后居然要我战胜足够多的npc才能挑战，都给我气笑了。然后根据地温泉门口那个辣鸡福瑞，居然三个三星，配音贱的一笔！关键是我就一个尼德霍格才能稳赢，另外几个三星全是辣鸡，一个也打不过。最后好不容易弄了个差不多的，并且抓好timing不讲武德干掉了他（主要是flyy找不到陀螺血的g，不然高低老早就flyy启动了）。最后个boss压迫感十足，居然有3个四星陀螺！这怎么打？！然后他就被我的辣鸡3星干死了，甚至不怎么需要抓timing，非常的无语。然后最终迷宫里，突然蹦出那个陀螺老头，也挺无语的。接下来是剧院小游戏，非常地欢乐，也能看出制作组在这里下了血本，120号同伴，每个同伴去扮演不同角色时，都有对应的配音！真的是太强大了！然而我并没有一个一个试，主要剧本的收集也很蛋疼，居然是刷新稀有道具，感觉跟幻水2的刷新还不太一样，第三个剧本刷了半天没出就不高兴刷了。另外用动物去扮演，台词就是不明觉厉的“啾啾、嘶”之类的，还挺搞的。厨师小游戏方面，摒弃了幻水2的调料选项，每种菜就一个做法，简化了很多，但是真的又臭又长。好处是挂机一段时间就能继续挑战下一个，且失败了可以继续挑战，不用推进剧情（幻水2要推进剧情才能挑战下一个，要是错过了几次就没办法挑战所有的厨师了，并且失败了也要等剧情推进才会重新出现，就得一直SL确保胜利）。然后感觉对方厨师都是傻子，菜品按照前菜、主菜、甜点分类，肯定是不能上错顺序的。好多时候能看到对面把主食当成前菜上，那能有个p的评分，身位厨师这点都不懂，装什么大尾巴狼。我遇到最离谱的就拿了8分，不知道的还以为评委跟你有仇。我还挺喜欢幻水2的叮当骰子，可惜没有了。总体来说，小游戏不太让人满意，要是卡牌的占比多一点，倒灶的陀螺少一点还好一些，另外厨师战也可以少一点，完全就是机械式的重复，没有任何乐趣。（陀螺是真让人恶心啊！）
人物数量：这次居然不是108个，而是120个，说实话多那点也无所谓，但是吃白饭的还是挺多的。不明觉厉的尤萨斯小学生，在对面的援护率是90%，在我这边的援护率1%是吧。澪看上去是个杀伐果断的冷血武士（杀手），但是用起来感觉好菜。好用的角色就那么几个，虽说升级很快，但不看攻略的话很少有人愿意试错。另外援助的人，收了艾儿之后，基本就没其他人什么事了，除了挖材料的时候换换人。尤其是哪个教官，居然让敌方比我方先行动，不知道有什么卵用。
最后说说几点，每个场景都有战斗宝箱，也就是出现“机关”字样，需要你去开，开的人会自动沉底行动条，让你被怪打，同时还有几率失败（五连败我还能说什么），手无缚鸡之力是吧，箱子都打不开？开了这个场景的就没了，后面要是再遇到，箱子也是处于打开状态，一般给的东西都不错（食谱或是强力防具、饰品）。另外带两个避怪护符，差不多100%不遇敌了，我在黑妹帮巫妖收付城堡的时候，有2个人带了，全程不遇敌。还有很多人说二周目还要看一遍剧情，按住B键就能跳过剧情。（我是在一周目夜晚潜入的时候发现的，当时按着B键走路，突然就钻进桶了，也没有剧情，我就意识到了什么）
总的来说，算是不错吧，但只推荐喜欢玩JRPG的玩家入手，尤其是幻水爱好者，不然应该很难玩得进去。其实地雷遇怪的频率比较低了，DDS系列的才叫频繁。目前正在打二周目开头，想给妹妹也刷一个战士之路。

quick review, se siente rpg clasico, el auto sirve en early o contra los random mobs, los jefes no todos tienen mecanica extra que hce mas divertido, el juego rewardea el backtrack y exploracion tanto con items como personajes. Realmente no es necesario el grind de niveles, la historia mismo te da la experiencia para avanzar. historia basica pero me gusto, la combinacion 2.5 hizo que las cosas se vean mas epicas de lo que debian pero tuvieron tambien limitante con los vfx que no se integraban bien o natural a los sprites 2d por completo. Ahora mis quejas, algunas cosas ya endgame o contenido extra, tiene el grind mas tedioso que he jugado en toda mi vida, sobre todo los beyblade, lo volvieron dull super rapido, no es claro con quienes debes pelear y complica el progreso, la de master chef tambien debes prestar atencion a los 100+ heroes y sus gustos y desbloquear comidas que combine estos gustos y no siempre acierta, las guias no ayudan mucho tampoco. expandir la base, toca ir manualmente a los recursos que respawnean como cada 5-10 minutos? se puede mandar quests a que otros reclutados consigan  pero eso toma 30 min y no es seguro. al final del juego ultimas 10 horas  kinda, toca hacer backtracking fuerte porque aparecen nuevos aliados en viejos sitios y pues side quest, tns tedioso. overall 8/10. Musica estuvo pro pero tampoco super memorable. habido mas minijuegos que no volvi pq no es obvio donde ir por ellos. parece no haber endgame dungeon? y no se como subire a lvl 99.

[b] Fair warning [/b] I recommend the game, but the review won't list much positives. I just like those old style games and the original Suikoden.

Sadly its a far cry from the original. Sure same story: you get rolled by a power, run away, build your own town and army..collect dozens of characters along the way.

[b] Minigames [/b]
are crap. the card game is good, theater is fun. Most other minigames revolve around farming the minigame item with the highest stat and then just watching. The cooking is easily won by reusing the same 3 recipes. Recipes have to be found or bought...discovery like in Suikoden 2 is nope. The chocobo race rippof you just hit start and watch the result .....

[b] Fighting [/b]
Solid all around. Problem is with chars. Units have short, mid or long range which determines if and from where they can attack enemy backline. Short is useless, they can only attack from your frontline and only the enemy frontline..with nothing to compensate for that. E.g. starting Character Mio is a short range samurai,starting Char Garr also swings a sword but has Mid range. Garr is generally tankier and has more strength..so what is the point of Mio ? With Perrielle you even get a squishy short range mage...

[b] War [/b]
All around solid.

[b] Characters [/b]
Mediocre. Not a single Millich Oppenheimer, Nanami, Kasumi or Pesmerga. Everyone is pretty much forgettable.

[b] final [/b]
Solid JRPG. likely better then Suioden 3 and 5, arguably even with Suikoden 4....miles away from Suikoden 1 and 2. If you like JRPG like this and don't expect another Suikoden 1/2 smash hit you are likely to have your fun.

I will start by saying that, as someone who enjoys turn-based RPGs, I did enjoy playing this one, but it has some issues that really bother me, and they are actually big enough for me to not recommend this one. I will start by the pros of this game
Pros 
- The game has a very nice progression, where you actually feel yourself getting stronger the more you go through the game.
- The combat system itself is fun and challeging, it doesn't feel like you are just doing the same action with the most optimal option dmg on every character, you actually have to think what skill to use and on which enemy, timing with your characters speed.
- The game does have a lot of hours to play, and interesting puzzles to solve, though it can be a con to some, for me this is nice, 
- The game does have a good amount of customization, as you have a lot of characters to choose from, and you can decide which magic element they use, and which playstyle you want on them. That said, this is not really well balanced, and there are characters that are clearly better than others, by a rather large margin, and they have a fixed way that makes them better in a specific playstyle, not really allowing much customization unless you don't care about being optimal.
- The graphics of the game are really nice.
Cons
- The game does sell itself a bit for having 100+ characters, but tbh a big part of them you don't even spend a whole minute talking to to recruit them, and they don't really have any big story or influence anything, really, and as said before, the diference in power between units are quite large, making me think, why bother then.
- The game has a really bad inventory system, designed this way for the players to have a sort of ''resource management'' game, and it does, but it is also really bad, as you feel like you cant carry anything in your bag, and leads to the next con.
- If you like to play with mages, which is the case for me, this is problably not the best game for you, as you basically are not allowed to use magic anywhere else if not on the boss of the dungeon you are in. Basically, every minimally useful spell costs 100MP+, and characters usually have 300+- mana on the endgame, meaning you can basically use 3 spells with a character per dungeon, which is really basically nothing, and tbh the spells are not even that strong in this game. And yes, there is a mana potion you can carry around, but you cant really buy them until really later in the story, and even then, you cant carry many of them in the bag due to inventory size being really constricting
- Your character moves kind of slowly inside dungeons and towns, and the only way to make you move faster is using one of your chars accessory slot, which is an important part of their strenght, or using a support character, giving up some other buffs, and the fast travel is only unlocked a bit before the halfway point of the game which is really bothersome.
- You cannot save whenever you want, you actually need to go to save points, and they really aren't everywhere.
- This is more of a rant as I use the keyboard to play, but the key mapping in this game is really bad, and you actually can't change it, and it took me a long time to adapt to it, but it makes me thing that the one who decided everything really doesn't play games on keyboard.
- The story itself is actually very cliched, and there really aren't any twists or turns or anything special in it, which is not a bad thing by itself, but I am someone who likes to read everything, but this one got me really bored.
- The battles are slow, and the war battles (kind of a story minigame) are even slower, and there is no skip buttons on animations or anything.
- There are some minigames, and the card one is actually fun, though a bit too easy once you understand how everything works, but the other 2 (the cooking and the beyblades) are actually just a mashing the Enter Key kind of minigames, and for me it just didn't work that well.
- The UI in this game is actually really bad, moving between menus is really tedious, and you have to confirm many times to do even the smallest of the tasks

There are some other things that I probably didn't comment on, as I don't want to write too much, but overall, this is a great game, but thorough the game, I caught myself thinking several times ''It just looks like they had a meeting on how to make the worst QoL possible for the game'', because you really feel all the little incoveniences of the game as you play it, and they really add up to frustrate you, and I personally think they are reason enough for me to not recommend it even though I enjoyed the game itself.

This is probably the first JRPG I have completed in a long time, and truthfully I couldn't tell you what exactly drew me in so strongly.  I think the pace of this game is wonderful, I think the combat, the characters and the story are good and entertaining. I think people weigh this game too strongly against Suikoden II, which is honestly a timeless RPG that will probably never have an equal. It took me around 75 hours to collect all the characters.
 
I want to say that I think the reason people don't think this game holds up from a story perspective, is that despite the game making it abundantly clear the main villain has committed horrendous atrocities, unlike Suikoden 2, we do not see them.  In fact, we see incredibly little of the villain doing villainous things. We see the result of those things, and we see who it effects and they even talk about it quite frequently, but we do not see them.   You are told the main bad guy is bad, and you are told regularly that they are bad (and to the game's credit, they are) and you experience one situation that is very clearly 'bad guy doing bad things' and there appears to be some interesting nuance to the villains, but all the interesting parts are told off-screen. 

Meanwhile, Suikoden II beat you over the head violently how awful of a human being Luca Blight was. You were deeply and horrifyingly aware of just what you were up against.  They focus more on the effects, and don't show you the cause. There were times where the big twists happen and it's the first you hear about it, and if I was reading a book I would consider it to be an interesting turn, but in video games I feel we would have felt a lot more impact if we saw those situations first hand.

I'm sure I'll be raked over the coals for saying it's just Suikoden II's story with less obvious viewpoints on the bad guys, but that's really what I parsed out of it. I enjoyed a vast array of the characters I was given, and surprisingly a larger amount of them than I was expecting are pretty viable for the game! (Maybe not the post game content,and some like Prunella for what you need to do to recruit them are absolutely garbage).

However, in the hopes that there will be an Eiyuden 2, I desperately need the developers of Rabbit and Bear to play a JRPG or any RPG past the 90s. There is a certain amount of charm in this game that can be described as a 'very good PS1 RPG' and in 2024 that has some really cool charm!  There is a wide list of small annoyances from how the inventory system works, how heroes are sorted (in some menus you can sort them, in others you can't?), and the mini-games are kind of poorly explained. 

I wanna state that the minigames are very fun in that weird PS1 RPG style that they could be whole ass games on their own, the card game is easy to pick up and is fun, the egg racing is pretty self-explanatory for the most part. But the Beigoma mini-game is weird and hard to really understand. There's no real mention of where these people are to battle, and it's really confusing that some of the key Beigoma that you use are from monster drops and very few are from actual beigoma duels meaning that the character locked behind them is probably going to be your last unless you REALLY like the beigoma minigame.  Not to mention that in order to continue the mini-game , you need to find these random people throughout the world and defeat them and without a guide you're basically just running around like a goober talking to every single NPC that isn't near a begioma table. 

The cooking mini-game's story is absolutely wild in the best way possible, and the same with Beigoma. I enjoyed them all the way through,

Combat is fast and snappy, and some characters are better in later game (Mio) than they are in the early game (Mio), and there's effectively no grinding. If you like a character but they feel weak, periodically scale them up and see if you can make them work! There are surprisingly few characters in this game that are absolute ass for the main game content.

Speaking of combat, I do not understand how magic is supposed to be. 90% of my experience with using offensive magic is that it was rarely worth the cost, maybe the higher ranking spells did much more damage. Momo, who is probably by far the best character in the game was the only time I realized magic COULD do more damage than physical, but I never experimented much because I never had much need to. 

That complaint aside, the combat is really fun and fiddling with characters and what works is a nice concept of the game, also a very cool thing is that you don't need Nowa in your combat party because they have a section in the party screen for story relevant characters, so you can do whatever you want throughout the game. very cool! 

All in all, I had a great experience playing through the game and I hope people give it a shot.

Hasta el final del juego estaba pensando en si recomendar o no el juego, aquí va:

Pros: 

-Gráficamente es muy bonito y recuerda a juegos de los noventa con más detalle.
-Si jugaste algún Suikoden rápidamente sentirás familiaridad con el juego.
-El juego generalmente es divertido.

Negativas:

-Traducción horrible (ejemplos ''Sugoi, sugoi!'' => ''Oh si nena, vamos!'' , ''Nigete kimashita'' => ''Ah, que peleles'')
-Bugs en buena cantidad, especialmente en la mazmorra final.
-Crasheos comunes (puede deberse a mi AMD 6750 XT).
-Autoguardado absolutamente inútil (por momentos sin uno solo tras 8 horas, esto más el anterior punto me provocaron una experiencia no muy agradable como es de suponer).
-Sistema de combate poco pulido, los combos heroicos son un chiste la grandísima mayoría de las veces  (daño comparable a los personajes haciendo un autoataque por separado y si cortan el turno de uno pierdes el de todos los participantes), el coste de la magia es altísimo y los métodos para recuperar MP en cantidades decente solo se abren en el final del juego, la diferencia entre atacante medo y lejano es casi inexistente...
-Personajes e historia poco interesantes y simplones, el primero se entiende (son 120) pero el segundo deja que desear.
-Los minijuegos con MUY aburridos y sinceramente parece estar ahí por estar, igual que el sistema de guerras.
-Las cinemáticas tiran peor que una rata un carro de piedras, a veces se quedan ''congeladas'' por tanto tiempo que crees que el juego crasheó. De hecho esta reseña la escribí durante la cinemática final, cinemática que me acabé teniendo que saltar porque llevaba casi 15 minutos esperando a que el juego se dignase a seguir y tenía miedo de otro crasheo.

Para terminar me gustaría decir que es una pena que acabaran por encasillarse demasiado en hacer ''otro Suikoden'', espero que la secuela o mejore los puntos flacos o busque tener una personalidad más allá del ''sucesor espiritual de Suikoden'', porque la verdad el potencial está ahí.

Buenas tardes.

Keeping this spoiler free, I'll just say that a character in the game told me he wants a particular stone held by a creature that resides in "forests". He only says the word "forests" once ever, and then just repeats the name of the stone, and the name of the creature each time you speak to him. Well, I missed that "forests" and didn't realize that meant this could be in ANY forest in this whole game world. So I spent two real life hours looking around the forest I thought I was supposed to before getting frustrated and googling. 

After finding the answer, I felt even more annoyed, thinking about the idea that I would be made to go to every single forest looking for hours for this one thing for this one guy. 

I LOVED Suikoden 1 and 2. It always bugged me a bit that I would be sitting with Google open beside me, looking up every super rare thing that many characters would vaguely reference. I would love to just sit and be in the game, in the world, engaged with it, and not hopping out of it so often to go look things up. It seems deliberate, the way these fetch quests are made so they can't actually be figured out, and just have to be meticulously combed for, or looked up. I don't mind grinding. I've been a big fan of some really grindy games. But, being tricked into looking in the wrong place for hours comes with no positive side whatsoever. 

Maybe the game needs a bestiary so these hints make more sense? I dunno. I've come away from more than a couple play sessions feeling like my time was wasted. I love a lot about this game despite that. But oof

ひとまずクリアするところまでプレイ、ここまで100時間弱。
少なくとも値段分の価値はあります。特にボイスに力を入れているようで、ランダムで誰かが一言喋る場面ですらボイス付きだったりします。ただ音量バランスがおかしくてキャラによってやたら声がデカかったり、主人公もデカい時と小さい時があったりしてしっかりとバランス調整がされてないような感じがします。あと温泉やエンディングもボイス欲しかったですね、というかエンディングでボイス無しは何故なのか…。

シナリオに関しては所々そうきたか！と思わせる場面があるものの、最後の方が明らかに急ぎ足でほーんくらいにしか感じず、最後の方は時間が足りなかった感が凄く出てました。エンディングで相当台無しにしちゃってます。
あとメリサが主人公面してますが、なんでその立場でこんな前面に出てる…？とかなり違和感。もうちょっとこの辺の理由作りが欲しかったところ。
JRPGと書かれているもののそういった要素があまり分からず、もしあれが一騎打ちでの結果ランダムのことを言っているのであれば、かなーーーりクソだと思います。負けてもすぐやり直せるからいいとかではなくあのシステムの一騎打ちそのものがホントダメ。

戦闘面は散々言われてますが、とにかく防御力が重要。敵からの攻撃を1に抑えられるキャラもいれば同じ攻撃で100以上くらうキャラもいたりとかなり極端。単純に攻撃力-防御力のみで計算してるみたいなのと、キャラによって数値がだいぶ違うので攻略が楽になるキャラ・厳しくなるキャラが決まっちゃっています。初心者の作るツクールゲーム並みにバランスが雑。
防御に徹するキャラやレンジがM・Lのキャラは後ろに置けるのでまだ良いのですが、レンジSかつ低装甲だと本当にどうしようもありません。ミオさん推しの方は愛で乗り切りましょう。ガオウさん推しの方は最後まで安心して使えます。
魔法攻撃も終盤にならないと消費MPに対して効果が付いてこないので必然的に魔法は回復・バフ・睡眠付与のみになりがち。

ミニゲームは思ったより多く、中でも全メンバーがフルボイスで演じる劇場、そしてカードゲームがなかなか面白い。ただしベイブｒ　ベーゴマバトルだけはクソ。終盤で強いコマ手に入れてから始めた方が良い、と言う仕様の時点で失敗してる。戦うたびに強くなるとのセリフが何回も出てくるもののそういった要素もなく、ただ強いコマを持っている者が勝者になれるだけという。

あと細かいところを言うとメニュー画面で装備や作戦を変更しようとすると地味にロードで足止めされたり、戦闘開始直後にパーティコマンドが出ているのに数秒待たされるとか、サブクエのリストが存在しないとか、セーブが宿屋やセーブポイントしかできないとか、変に不便だったりするところがあるのがマイナス点。
一番無いなと思ったのは、敵モンスターや背景がCGでぬるぬる動くのにキャラはドット絵でカクカク、なんでわざわざキャラだけドット絵にしたのかが本当にわけわからないです。幻想水滸伝1や2に近付けたかったのか予算の都合だったのか。
もはや古き良く、ではなく古臭く不便。
そう言ったマイナス要素も合わさり、総合評価としては68点くらいかなと。良いところも多いのに悪いところが凄い足引っ張ってるんですよね…。
A spiritual successor of Suikoden that will remind you of old school RPG in both good and bad ways While it is annoying to 100% complete the game, I also enjoy every moment of it.

Although the story may not match the masterpiece that is Suikoden 2, the gameplay remains engaging and surpasses most RPGs in general.

The mix of pixel graphics and 3D isn't ideal; I would have preferred full pixel graphics, but that's just my preference.

Honestly, I was quite surprised to read so many negative comments from players because, despite not being on the same level as Suikoden 2, this game is still one of the best ever made.

Regardless, if you consider yourself a Suikoden fan and are giving negative comments on Yoshitaka Murayama's final work, you should question yourself again. Respect this person for striving to bring back our childhood memories once more.

I recommend the game as both a JRPG fan and as a Suikoden fan.

The story is good and interesting. It is at its foundation the standard hero's journey, but with enough twists and nuance to keep one engaged. Many of the characters are intriguing and will make you wish we had more back story or scenes for them.

The game's combat is fun, not overly challenging but the boss fights feel like something has been accomplished. The inclusion of special gimmicks in some fights spices thing up. As a Suikoden fan, it is nice to have something like the old Rune system back again.

The soundtrack is not to be missed and sometimes raises this game to epic heights. Especially for the duels.

The background and setting visuals are splendid. I am not one for nostalgia over 8-bit, 2D models, but the characters seem to be well done if you are in to that sort of thing. We can only hope that with this game's success, a sequel with more funding might lead to 3D characters.

The game of course is not perfect and a few things can be bothersome. There is altogether too little info about stats and statuses. The menus provide no tool tips for what stats and attributes do. As far as I can tell, there is no way to check the status of either party members or enemies in the middle of combat, which is not helpful in a turn-based rpg. Figuring out how to make all of this sort of information more readily available to the player would make the game much more enjoyable.

It is also strange that the camera is locked in dungeons and towns when it is not on the world map. The environments appear to be carefully crafted, beautiful settings (that are mostly finished). It would be both more pleasing to be able to look around them at will and it would make moving around feel more natural.

Some of the side games can be a bit tiring. The requisite collecting of all the rpg fish never ceases to bemuse with its inclusion. The beigoma spinning top game seems entirely pointless. We certainly could do without the merchant trading task -- I play video games to escape the horrors of capitalism, not to indulge them. The card game can be a fine thing to do and just watch a show. The cooking game can surprisingly be amusing. And, yes, there are more side games than this...

This last one is from particularly the perspective of a Suikoden fan. I know this game is not Suikoden VI, and it would be unfair to expect it to be. However, while the game seems to be crafted to pull in a new audience, it is also definitely built to retain those of us who grew up that other series. In that regard, it would be nice if at least one of the tritagonists was older. Not all the heroes in this game had to be children. We could have had one like Geddoe from SIII and had a vicarious mixing of the generations in the game that matched the players the studio no doubt hoped for.

Anyways, if you are looking for a solid JRPG, Eiyuden Chronicle is certainly a good choice for you. If you are a Suikoden fan, you will probably be a fan of this as well.

When Eiyuden Chronicles: Hundred Heroes was announced, I never imagined we’d get something so reminiscent of the beloved Suikoden series. Though it sometimes feels like a simplified version of Suikoden II, this game is a must-try for any Suikoden fan.

The Good:

Let’s start with the positives. The art style is stunning and truly captures the Suikoden essence. Junko Kawano has outdone herself, and the game's 2D pixel sprites are both beautiful and expressive. The translation from concept art to in-game visuals is seamless, though I would have loved to see even more focus on the 2D elements, reserving 3D for specific animations or key scenes.

The music in Eiyuden Chronicles is another highlight. While I don’t consider myself an expert on soundtracks, each track felt both appropriate and catchy without ever becoming repetitive. The overall sound design is excellent, and the voice acting, although featuring actors I wasn’t familiar with, was impressive and added depth to the characters.

The localization also deserves a nod. Although there were a few instances of awkward sentences, it wouldn’t be a Suikoden-like experience without these quirky moments. Despite some controversy, I didn’t find anything in the localization worth getting upset over.

The combat system, though a bit simplistic, is enjoyable. The Auto function works well for random battles, and the animations are engaging. There are plenty of combination attacks and interesting spells to keep things lively.

The minigames are a fun distraction. The card game, while simple, is entertaining, and I found the beigoma game quite amusing once I got the hang of it. The cooking minigame is a nostalgic throwback to Suikoden II, though I do miss the fishing minigame from Eiyuden Rising.

The Not-So-Good:

Now, onto areas where the game falls short.

The story feels like a watered-down version of a Suikoden narrative, lacking the dramatic weight of previous entries. The most intense moment involves a village being burned down, with all the inhabitants surviving unscathed. This is a far cry from the gut-wrenching moments like Luca Blight’s ruthless actions or Gremio’s heart-wrenching sacrifice. The war never feels like an imminent threat, as territories can be visited without any visible impact from the conflict.

Dux Aldric, the antagonist, is neither particularly threatening nor clever, and I didn’t feel that any of the three main characters had a strong personal stake in defeating him. This lack of compelling villainy is a significant departure from the likes of Luca Blight or Gizel Godwin.

In a game boasting over 100 characters, some are bound to feel underdeveloped, but this game takes it to an extreme. Like in Suikoden I or IV, many characters lack depth. Because the war doesn’t seem to matter, the characters don’t have a compelling reason to join the group, making their inclusion feel arbitrary.

The castle, while visually stunning and evolving throughout the game, is disappointingly static. Characters simply appear in fixed locations and remain there for the entire game, giving the castle a lifeless feel.

The “tactical” battles and duels are also letdowns. The duels feature beautiful animations but are overly simplistic, relying on a rock-paper-scissors mechanic with minimal strategic depth. The tactical battles, on the other hand, are time-consuming and devoid of strategy—you merely pick your characters and charge at the enemy, which feels like a missed opportunity for more engaging gameplay.

Final Thoughts:

Despite its flaws, Eiyuden Chronicles: Hundred Heroes is a charming game that evokes the spirit of late 90s and early 2000s JRPGs. The development team has hinted at the possibility of an Eiyuden II, even after the unfortunate passing of Murayama. I remain hopeful that it will see the light of day and bring the same level of improvement that Suikoden II brought over its predecessor.

고전적인 턴제 rpg. 캐릭터들 이등신으로 찍어서 옛날 감성을 냈지만 배경같은 이모조모를 보면 꽤나 세심하게 만들었다. 전체적으로는 꽤 재미있는데 단점도 몇개 있다.
1. 마나 수급을 할 수 없다. 일단 휴식 후에 마을에서 떠나면 마나게이지에 차있는 마나로 다시 돌아올때까지 써야된다고 보면 된다. 사냥시 가끔 마나 아이템을 주는데 그걸로는 택도 없다. 나중에 본진 도구가게 업글을 최후까지 찍으면 본진에서 팔긴 하는데 이미 게임 극후반부다. 그래서 게임이 매우 단조롭게 흘러간다. 많은 마나를 이용한 마법이 있지만 위의 이유로 거의 쓰질 못한다. 평타나 sp를 이용한 스킬로만 운용하게 된다.
2. 가방이 너무 빡빡하다. 최초 30칸인데 템 중복이 굉장히 적은수만 되기 때문에 체력물약 빼곤 거의 아무것도 못들고 다닌다. 그리고 가방확장을 하려면 본진에 관련 테크를 올려야 하는데 이 테크에 필요한 영웅을 소지하고 있어야 한다. 그런데 얘를 고용안하고 그냥 지나치기 매우 쉬워서 난 60랩까지 30칸짜리 썼다. 
3. 위 가방에 관련해서 쓴거랑 연관이 있는데 테크관련 필수 영웅을 찾기 힘든구조다. 그래서 여간 불편한게 아니다. 결국 구글링해서 찾게되는데 이러면 결국 이런식으로 영웅을 발견해서 써먹게 하는 시스템을 구성한 의미가 크게 퇴색된다. 그리고 어떤 영웅은 작정하고 꽁꽁 숨겨놔서 구글링 해도 찾기 힘들정도다. 이건 미니게임과도 관련있는데 어떤 미니게임은 끝까지 깨야 영웅이 들어오는 구조로 되있어서 미니게임을 싫어해도 억지로 이악물고 해야되는 상황이 올 수도 있다. 설상가상으로 미니게임 구성도 요리조리 꼬아놔서 이 미니게임 진행 조차도 공략을 보고 진행 해야될 수도 있다.
전체적으로는 재미있게 잘 만든 게임이지만 세부사항에서 스스로 재미를 크게 깎아먹는 구성도 많아서 아쉬움이 좀 남는 게임이다.

I really wanted to like the game, as a massive fan of the Suikoden series growing up I was looking forward to this for a while. Only to be let down by weak game systems, mechanics, tedious/repetitive gameplay, terrible character development, and an utterly horrendous localization/translation.

At least with some of the bad systems, you can avoid them, but there is no avoiding conversations in the game. Characters are made to be irritating (not found in the original dialogue), using internet slang ("EPIC WIN", "git gud", and more) that has absolutely zero place in the game, and generally making the dialogue utterly skippable, despite not having a way to skip it.

The enjoyment of the game is ruined, it's an RPG, I'm supposed to be immersed in the story, but constantly taken out of it by a horrible translation attempt. Worst of all, the publishers/developers refuse to address it, do not buy.

Eiyuden Chronicle: Hundred Heroes is a standard JRPG whose main value proposition is the presence of more than a hundred characters to collect and a strong style. The collection of these colorful characters is nice as is the development of the headquarters. If the concept interests you, I would wait for the Suikoden remakes instead.

I have to say though without nostalgic bias that in its current state: Eiyuden doesn't meet the bar that was set in Suikoden 2.  I played through the first two games and loved them decades ago.  I can see where this game is trying to stay loyal to the original games.  The mechanics are ok.  I miss the ability in the previous games to take every character and level them up.  Add a chef to the team and turn him into a lvl99 monster.  This game you gain characters that you can battle with and characters that are just support which is disappointing.  This is not a dig about not enough characters because there are almost too many.  There were many characters I never played with but part of that was because I just wanted to get through the game.  Most of the game is voiced which I can see adds polish and production value but to me its a negative.  I have started skipping the conversations because I just read too fast.  The spoken sentence would be over and it would just hang before the next person would start speaking.  I like the mechanics of building the castle as it gives you things to do between moving from point A to B.  However again it felt like a rushed add on.  I never used any of the buildings I built.  There were always better armor, upgrades, or items in other towns.  The special facilities like the onsen I never used.  These places were always outside your normal travel path so they didn't add much to the castle.  There are side missions people give you but there is no way to track them.  If you are in the middle of something and you cant be bothered you need to remember who the person was and where they were at to go back.  These were basically missing to get that character to join you.  None of the characters I really like because there are just too many and they are all your 8-15yr old kids that are saving the world per usual anime tropes.  I think this whole game could be turned around if the story was better.  The story is so basic and generic that I just don't care.  The whole focus is on creating a reason for you to go from town to town to find new characters.  At the end of the game there were two protagonists that just disappeared from the story.  Maybe a sequel will be made.  Those characters motives never were explored and seemed like they would have been more interesting than the main story in the game.  If this games story was significantly better I would have wanted to live in the world, find all the characters, do the castle side missions, and explore different party combinations. 
 I finished the game but it was a slog.  If you want a game to compare this to look at Ni No Kuni II.  Its the same game but done very well.  The game does play perfect on steam deck which is a big plus.

[h1]传统的JRPG，故事慢节奏的诉说[/h1]

[h1]前言[/h1]
相信不少小伙伴在游玩本作前，都去体验了《百英雄传撅起》这么个外传作品（我知道是崛起，没打错字）。其实外传作品的品质也还是可以的，但由于各种限制导致体验并不是那么好，也让我在本作发售前就产生了那么一点点的抗拒。但那句老话说的好啊，理论再多，不如实践一番，在体验了本作之后，感觉立马就不同了。虽说本作有部分缺点，但开发组也并没有闲着，在不远的未来也将会给我们带来全新的体验，本篇评测局限于发评测时的当前版本，仅做参考~

[h1]被欺负了怎么办，当然是打回去啦~[/h1]
故事发生在一个魔幻的大路上，有这么两个势力相互制衡着，一边是强势的帝国，一边是散乱的联盟，而咱们的主角就不幸的是联盟中的一员。起初咱们只是做为一个小佣兵，在联盟里混口饭吃，然而刚当上佣兵，就跟着帝国的人员进行遗迹的探索，并在遗迹中寻找到一枚极其罕见的“原初透镜”。然而在找到透镜之后，风平浪静了半年，迎来的不是帝国对于透镜的研究成果，而是帝国的侵略。本就散乱的联盟，根本不会因为咱们主角在在联盟的城镇而放弃进攻，即便是曾经并肩作战的战友，也不曾手软。

然而古人诚不欺我，哪里有压迫哪里就有反抗（妈妈说）。咱们的主角团和大小姐一起被赶出了大小姐所统领的城市，和大小姐走散的主角谨记大小姐的嘱托，于是乎开始在荒郊野岭建立城市，开始了我们的反抗之路。而帝国的野心并不会止步于此，他们的目标也不仅仅局限于一个“原初透镜”。于是拉锯战就开始展开了，我们一边拉拢有共通目标的同伴，一边阻止帝国的阴谋，主打的就是个你不顺心我就开心。当力量积攒的足够了，也就开始了属于我们的反击时刻。

整体故事还是比较王道的传统JRPG故事，主角团从底层一点点雄起，成长的过程虽然坎坷，却充满了对未来的希望。一个人的力量是渺小的，那如果一群人呢？对吧~虽然游戏中有100多个角色登场，其实每一个角色的故事并没有进行详细的刻绘，导致对于很多角色只能留下一个知道的印象。但好在胜于量多，而且即便你携带的是不同的队友，在进行剧情时也都会参与对话，并不会像某些游戏，一到主线就全员失踪，还是挺不错的。

[h1]比较传统的回合制[/h1]
为啥这里要说比较传统呢，其实是因为本作很多角色释放技能，并不需要消耗传统的MP值，而是SP值。本作中玩家角色主要指标有三种，传统的HP和MP，以及新加入的SP。前俩者经常玩JRPG的都懂，而SP值则是每个回合都会增加一个，满值也就5个。许多角色的技能都是通过消耗SP值释放的，只有和魔法相关的才会消耗MP。这样的机制很好的弥补了非法师职业MP过少的职业缺陷，令非法师职业可以在战斗中频繁的释放技能，反倒是法师职业时不时的就需要喝个小蓝瓶。

[h1]人数众多，却一次只能登录6个[/h1]
本作虽然跟游戏名一样，有着100多个角色，但实际经常使用的，却不会多。咱们的队伍一次至多编组6人，辅助1人，可额外携带剧情必须角色3名，也就是说剧情必要的角色也可以不用登场。这样的情况，也就直接导致了我们能照顾到的角色其实是有限的，无论是新入队的角色，还是坐板凳的角色，在未编入队的情况下都不会获得经验值。也就是说每入队一个角色，你至少要拉出来打上那么几场，否则级别只能来时啥样还啥样啦。虽说级别较低的角色，通过战斗可以很快的赶上主力部队的等级，但依旧显得很繁琐。

[h1]其他缺点相关[/h1]
游戏中有不少缺点，不过开发既然决定要退出大更，这里就仅提出预告之外的部分内容。游戏中编队的繁琐度可以进行优化一下，初期角色少的时候，并不会显得编队太难受，随着新角色的增加，编队选择角色会变得越来越难受。支线部分其实也需要优化一下，游戏初期就能够感受到，3个角色的任务在同一个地方，却需要玩家跑三次，相当繁琐，并且这个情况在游戏中后期也非常的明显。初期其实就该加入一个传送方式，在我们建立抵抗军基地之后，如果想要回到之前的城市，就需要自己重新从迷宫跑回去，真的很麻烦。

[h1]最后[/h1]
整体来说，本作虽然有着一些缺点，却也守护着传统JRPG的风格，引导对传统JRPG感兴趣的玩家入门。游戏初期难度比较低，到了游戏中期开始，就需要玩家着重的考虑队伍搭配，为队伍的角色练级，刷材料建设家园等等。这些事占据了玩家绝大多数时间，反倒是跑迷宫比较简单一些。暗雷式遇敌并不适合所有玩家，却也能让许多遗老感到熟悉的味道。很适合喜欢传统回合制JRPG，能够接受慢节奏培养的小伙伴，当然也适合喜欢看小人物成长为带英雄故事的小伙伴啦~
With all it's flaws, it still deserves a thumbs up.

Eiyuden Chronicle gave me one of the most unique experiences I have ever had with JRPGs. It brought back things I experienced when I played games from the PS1 as a kid, being items and recipes. The trade outpost mechanic is also really interesting when I played Tradewinds with my first PC.

Seign Kesling is my favorite characters, from his personality to his moveset to his physical design. Everything about this game was an emotional rollercoaster. Each character you have to recruit has their own story, and the overall message in the game is that there is someone or something that is worth protecting and that your beliefs are worth standing up for. Stand up for what's right even if there is no one behind you.

Duels - AMAZING, weird mechanic but the first time I've ever seen it. When Nowa faces Seign, it felt like a battle of ideals, and it's really cool that there are two endings. Runes are also a significant mechanic as well, made the customization very fun. I like the armor and weapon mechanics - upgrade what you have and buy new physical armor.

Every boss fight is fair, the game itself does a great job of leveling your characters at a fair pace. They make the Dux Aldric guy a really despicable villain. Throughout the game, just when you think you have a moment of victory, something takes you down. That's war and luck. What a fitting end to make the last boss battle a duel with Brave Flags theme remastered

There is no swearing in this game, which is fine. I still didn't expect to see a kid get his arm chopped off, and then we recruit him with "Armed and Ready" as his title.

Worst mechanics: Sand Shiarc timed racing. Also, I don't like Wars. Once you get used to it, they're cool, but let's talk about the shiarc racing. If you're using a Playstation controller, you're screwed because the analog controls are inverted. It doesn't feel good to play this mode. You have to resort to using the d-pad to move. Overall, to recruit one unit and to also proceed the story, you have to do 2 races, and it's really frustrating.

i love suikoden 2 more, excited for the remake. while waiting, this game is a good alternative for the mean time.

Overall i rate this game 7/10, very descriptive i know.... there is a lot of good things in this game but also a lot of bad to terrible things as well.

My hopes for the next game would be an at least satisfactory English localization, tighten up the main story mini games (the war game, and the 1v1 dueling), and generally improve the overall story. This is however a pretty good first main game for this franchise if they continue to make them.

     The Good:
for fans of Suikoden this game will have a lot of elements similar to the beloved franchise that are generally very well implemented. There are a large number of colorful characters to recruit for both use in your battle party and for other uses in your home base, you have a base of opperations you can build up over time, A number of combat elements will be familiar including hero combos, runes, magic (though it uses a mana system, personally i miss the slot based system of suikoden), the battle formation though more basic than some suikoden games, weapon upgrade system. there is a war game system though its kinda basic it gets the job done. there are a number of fun mini games that are part of side quests you can do.

    The Mid
Like suikoden gams there is a 1v1 duel system though it is not used particularly well, most of them are heavily scripted. the first duel isn't scripted, you don't need to win it but the story flows more satisfyingly if you do. you need to be kinda overleveled to win though and there really isn't much reward just a better flowing cutscene.

there is a magic attribute compatibility system for magic runes that the game doesn't tell you about. I like the idea of the system but you basically have to look up a guide to use it.

one of the things i personally miss about suikoden was magic combos where if you had compatible magic runes you could cast combo magic, there is no such system in this game, it doesn't really need it, but its just a personal taste thing for me for a suikoden tribute game.

the story is pretty generic overall. at some points the story seems a little confused about what its overall lesson is but its otherwise a pretty straight forward RPG plot. serviceable but nothing special. There are times when the story is pretty decent in the middle of a chapter but on the grand scale its very generic.

      The Bad
there is a "rare find" system where shops occasionally have a rare item. this wouldn't be bad if it were just rare armors or duplicate one of a kind items, but it is required to recruit and optional character and to complete some side quests. This system is infuriating as some items have as low as 5% chance to appear in a shop and the chance resets every 30 minutes. if you want these items do yourself a favor and look up how to save scum these items. save scumming is still very annoying though.

The english localization is poorly done, and includes a number of mean spirited jokes targeting people who call out these lazy and selfish localization practices. If there is another game they should hire a different english localization studio and/or keep a tighter leash on the localization. there are several moments were the english localization completely misses the original concepts or worse breaks the story immersion with there poor taste commentary.

[h1] Rune of Rose Tinted Glasses [/h1]

TL;DR Eiyuden Chronicle: HH is a lovingly crafted homage to Suikoden series, offering an excellent experience with its story, character development, and strategic gameplay. It does have a few rough edges in balance and depth in mini-games. If you have a fondness for Suikoden and are willing to overlook some minor flaws, Eiyuden Chronicle is definitely worth your time. Personal Suiko rating: II > V > I >>> III > IV > EC:HH.

I played this game in JP voice acting and EN gameplay.

[h2] Good [/h2]
[olist] 
    [*] [b] Nostalgic Charm: [/b] EC:HH brings back hundreds of hours on Playstation 1 & 2 grinding for recruitment to save Gremio/Nanami. The game captures what made those games great for me -- stunning and diverse characters, and their interacting storylines. From our dearest wolf beast man Garr, to shi'arc culture, to a talking capybara and his son in charge of your town's onsen.    
    [*] [b] Beautiful Art Style: [/b] The 2.5D pixel art style is simply well done. This aesthetic appeal is further enhanced with vibrant animations. I will never forget Yusuke's yakuza-style pink jacket coat swaying in the wind during the victory scene.
    [*] [b] Base Building: [/b] The signature castle base building has always been a great source of satisfaction and EC:HH captures this feeling perfectly. Without spoilers, I would suggest to build the Theatre as soon as you can.
[/olist]

[h2] Bad [/h2]
[olist] 
    [*] [b] Game Balance: [/b] The game could benefit more from supporting different play styles. From LV 1-45, you rely on PWR characters, because EC:HH moved away from Suikoden's cast X spells a day, to Final Fantasy style MP cost. However, Max MP for characters at the start are abysmally low, so casting 3 Flame Walls might fully drain a character's MP. You're much better off saving MP for healing, which is a little monotone.
    [*] [b] A Story Without Consequence: [/b] One of the hallmarks for Suikoden is the story telling. With Suikoden I, you get plunged into a  magical world asking questions like "Should I be around people? I AM CURSED WITH SOUL EATER RUNE", "How old is Luc?", "HOW TF DO I SAVE GREMIO?". Needless to say, Suikoden II does an even better job with the legendary Luka Blight and your best friend Jowy standing on the wrong side of the story. EC:HH on the other hand hits below its weight class: the Dux is just another a vanilla power hungry aristocrat; Lian is just an airhead Nanami wannabe; Leene your sister disappears for 80% of the game. Personally, the handful characters I liked didn't add any gravitas to the story for me e.g. Perielle, Mio, Hakugin, Maxim. 

Thanks for reading my rant!

之前在xgp通关了，玩得很开心，就在这边买了一份。可惜存档转不了。
=======
93小时全同伴食谱钓鱼卡牌陀螺各种全收集完成（项目太多了😂），无尽爬塔打到26层拿完奖励撤退。

这大概是我一段时间以来玩得最开心的游戏了，也是第二款在xgp玩了后想买一份的，第一款是p4g。

说几个我很喜欢的地方。

从故事上讲，有三个主角，但游戏过程中只要你愿意，绝大多数的战斗都可以不用上这三个人包括剧情boss战。所以我就可以很开心的用准美少女战队通关游戏。之所以“准”是因为其实有一位连女性都不是😂。

第二个点就是这个经验值计算机制，虽然队友众多，但不管替补和主力等级差多少，打三四场当前进度的战斗就能追得差不多，所以替换阵容毫无压力。完全不会有很多游戏中后期队友完全上不了场的问题。

第三就是演剧。五部剧，全队友都有配音且各有演出风格，属于是游戏的核心宝藏内容，几乎碾压各种游戏里的小游戏部分了😂。甚至怀疑这游戏全语音完全是因为要录这个演剧内容，就顺便把游戏的其他部分的配音也给做了。

再说说槽点吧。

前面好的部分是做得真好，但其他粗糙的部分呢，做得也是真糙。比如城镇里路人很多，也全有对话内容，但基本全部是不能侧面展现任何世界观的简单短语复读，比起霸剑霄云录那种偌大的城没人说话，这种还更恐怖点儿。我觉得与其要为了给众筹金主安排位置，还不如都放到集团战的阵亡名单里去，把城镇还给真正的npc😂。

接下来这个就厉害了，是最大的槽点。游戏在终章开始后会安排一个最亲密的女性同伴和男主在阳台上有一段对话演出，这个正常。但这个亲密度是怎么算的呢？毕竟这游戏也不能送礼物也没有好感度对话之类，这游戏的计算方式是平时互动次数。有意思的就来了，基于没有即时存档，升级和存档点不回复hpmp，物品栏也限制数量，所以玩家平时做得最多的两件事就是跑旅馆免费恢复加存档，以及跑仓库存包，而这两项内容也是由两位女性同伴负责的......别的我就不多说了😂。

其他诸如路人npc的语言英译中翻译腔过重，没有即时存档，暗雷遇敌，类ff12的超简版自动战斗设置基本只能用节约模式，这些都是属于可以改进的地方，能忍😂。

Tenho uma lembrança muito reconfortante quando joguei Suikoden II pela primeira vez em meados de 2000. Um amigo me emprestou o CD. Dizendo que era um jogo simples mais divertido, ele mesmo não terminou. Lembro de ter comprado por 10 reais um CD com uma impressão na locadora M&M. Meses depois comprei um novo CD que deixava guardado com um guardanapo para não arranhar a cópia.

Durante um longo período tentei compreender a verdadeira causa que fez um jogo tão simples transmitir algo que eu nunca havia sentido jogando um jogo de vídeo-game.

Hoje creio que seja a combinação da leveza dos traçõs de Fumi Ishikawa, do emblemático roteiro de Yoshitaka Murayama junto as inesquecíveis composições de Miki Higashino. Tais como as runas dos destinos esses três fizeram uma combinação perfeita.

Posteriormente joguei o I por emulação e conheci o belíssimo trabalho de Junko Kawano. Não sou de recordar nome dos desenvolvedores de jogos, mas Suikoden foi uma obra que realmente desejei saber quem eram os responsáveis por criar algo que tanto admiro.

Não tinha esperanças que algo relacionado a série fosse lançada. Eiyuden foi uma grande surpresa para todos os fãs. O jogo foi anunciado no início da pandemia, foram dias pesados. Foi um momento onde evitei ler os noticiários sensacionalistas que faziam questão de lucrar em cima da desgraça alheia. Nesse momento de falta de esperança, Eiyuden uma lente de luz que me incentivou a seguir em frente.

Um esplendoroso forte construído pelo esforço dos criadores e dos fãs. Um dos maiores exemplos de campanhas do Kickstarter. Todos os meses recebíamos relatórios com diversos detalhes sobre seu desenvolvimento. Tenho orgulho e uma imensa felicidade te ter feito parte dessa construção.

O jogo é um RPG clássico de turnos, onde você se aventura com três protagonistas e seus dramas. A história é bem mais leve que Suikoden, embora alguns elementos lembrem os jogos passados. Uma boa analogia, seria algo como tentar comparar Game of Thrones e Lord of Rings.

Existem alguns pontos que gostaria de acrescentar como músicas únicas por cidades, transição mais rápida entre os ataques e cenas. Uma musiquinha da Miki e uma ilustração da Fumi, mas são pequenos detalhes comparada as novidades.

A história é linda, muitos persoangens legais. Gostaria de morar em Hishan, a trilha é fabulosa, muitos vão deixar em loop a épica Bandeira de Bravos. Uma lente bruta emerge em mundo rodeado de jogos rasos e sem vida.

O jogo possui mais de 130 personagens que são dublados em japonês e inglês. Eu recomendo muito para quem gosta de animes jogar em japonês, você reconhecerá a voz de diversos dubladores renomados. Por isso, antes de reclamar do preço, lembre-se do quão trabalhoso deve ter sido investimento e gerenciamento de todos esses profissionais.

Deixo meus sinceros agradecimentos a ilustradora Junko Kawano, ao diretor Junichi Murakami, ao game designer Osamu Komuta e principalmente ao inesquecível diretor Yoshitaka Murayama por trazer esperança aos nossos corações.

[h1]百英雄传~再现经典继续前进[/h1]
百英雄传作为一款JRPG游戏重现经典的续作，剧情上捏，作为主角的诺瓦一开始只是王城里一位默默无闻的守卫新兵，另一位角色则是作为主角好友塞恩则是帝国的军官，随着故事的发展战争不断的爆发，我们的主角诺瓦就会成为同盟军的领袖，我们建立属于自己的据点可以装扮也可以摆放各种奇奇怪怪的雕像，在此期间也是联合不同的国家来反抗挑起战争的帝国，在反抗的过程中你会在满世界的寻找各地区的英雄好汉扩大同盟军的势力，作为幻水系列的延续，但是却和幻水不一样的集中点（幻水比较集中在角色上，百英比较集中在战争上对角色的描写确实没有幻水那么出彩），游戏其实比较复古，除了场景上采用了3D之外，其余的一切都是以复古的，像2d像素风格的角色和随机遇怪的系统非常严苛的角色血量数值管理和基本等同与没有的任务提示，而且游戏一开始的阶段基本都处于跑图模式也没有可以快速传送功能（虽然后面会有加速的鞋子但是一开始得适应这要繁琐跑图的机制）。
游戏也是和名字一样可以找寻高达百位的队友（其实超一百了具体多少不清楚），这百来个英雄也是形形色色，可以满足你各种收集欲和xp，比如有伪娘马猴烧酒，还有很多亚人种角色出现，百英这个游戏和别的RPG还有一点不太一样是，百英的任务做完都是可以邀请到一位角色加入队伍的（虽然还有加入条件且还都不一样，有些加入还得下迷宫），招募这些同伴是百英的核心玩法，部分的英雄也有很大的用处（比如要塞里的各种设施厨房配厨师，农场配农夫），游戏中跑图这点真得说说，很多时候你需要各种跑图找npc接任务可能有些地方已经跑过知道那地方没有人了，经典的来了随着据点升级本来知道那地方没有npc的突然长出一个野生的npc导致你有时候又要重新地毯式搜索一次属于非常的阴间。
战斗的玩法就是回合制，部分角色可以依靠sp发动技能，魔法攻击需要消耗mp，部分角色之间可以使用合击技能（威力大不大实不用实用放一边，至少看着很帅气），游戏里是可以下迷宫的，不过进入后就不能够补给了（所以基本每次下本都要考虑怎么运用效率高的队伍分配的道具也要合理使用，同时也要多利用场景里的机关），角色可以换装备上符文（符文这东西很强力数值提升巨大一些还可以学新技能）。还有就是游戏的另一个玩法，战争模式毕竟主打的就是一个战争嘛，基本也没有啥玩法就是多招募角色往前顶着推进一路放技能基本就可以赢。还有就是游戏内含有的各种小游戏（不过需要找到相对应的英雄才行）
总结下来就是好玩是好玩的但是有点吃情怀如果不是系列作品的粉丝的话，玩起来还是比较痛苦的，毕竟游戏也属于慢热的类型，很多地方沿用的也是复古的玩法和产物对新手玩家来说确实不算太友好，不过具体怎么样还需靠玩家的个人体验。

Game is good for what it is - a separate entity from its main inspiration. 

If you're coming in closed minded and that it should exactly be like Suikoden, then you'll be disappointed. It is tough to beat nostalgia, the joy of youth, the innocence/lack of exposure to other stories.

The story could be better but at the same time, old RPG fans have probably just been exposed to a myriad of stories already that it's very hard to come up surprised by any game at this day and age. Everything is on repeat. All the curve balls and swerves in terms of story lines have already been presented to us. 

While Eiyuden could use a number of QoL updates (and they have patches), I think it's still a great game to play. Definitely worth my time waiting as a KS supporter.

クリア直前で止まってるプレーヤーです。
物語は王道オブ王道、幻水っぽいなって思います。
大体諸国連合はいつも足並み揃ってない感！
でも主人公を起点に皆が集まって団結していく、まさに幻水を体験できる物語になっています。
ほぼフルボイス付きで、棒読みみたいな駆け出しの声優さんも全くいません！
幻想水滸伝好きなら買っても良い作品だと思います。

が、ここからは悪い点！
・使用キャラが固定になりがち！
YouTubeで皆さんが上げられている通り、使えるキャラ（最強キャラ）が決まっています！
自分が推しのキャラが結局二軍倉庫番で救いようがありません！
ルーンでステータスアップはあるものの微妙、貴重なルーン枠をステアップの為に使うの？？？
ステータスアップ系のアイテムがなぜ無いのか・・・
敵からのドロップで底上げ出来るなら、何時間も苦にならないのに！

・ビルド構築皆無
基本的に難易度がノーマルだろうと敵の攻撃が痛いです！
Sレンジタンク役のキャラは防御命なので、Sレンジ紙装甲キャラは足手まといでしかない。
紙装甲でも回避が高いとか、回避アップの装備で化ける！
しかもカウンター装備と合わせれば！！！
っとかのビルド構築も残念ながら皆無です。
みなが言う序盤の女剣士の存在感が序盤で弱すぎてうっとおしくなります。

・戦闘のテンポが悪い
幻想水滸伝２などは、連続攻撃がかなり魅力的！
返し刃の紋章付けて、何度も連続攻撃＆クリティカルで戦闘がスムーズだったのに対し、百英雄伝はお一人様一回限りの攻撃となります。
雑魚敵すらも固い＆強い、お一人様一回限り攻撃で戦闘のテンポがすごく悪く感じました。
雑魚一層の全体攻撃はあるものの、MP消費激しくて連発出来ない・・・

・アイテム持てない問題
このご時世でこんなにアイテム持てないゲーム久しぶりかも・・・
そんな所は古い仕様やめましょうよ・・・
一応サポートキャラやらでアイテム持てるサイズは増えるものの、未鑑定アイテムが重ならない為、手に入れた未鑑定アイテムを心苦しくずっと捨て続けるプレーヤーは多かったのでは？
アイテム増やせるキャラが仲間になるのちょっと後の方なので、序盤のアイテム整理は結構苦痛でした。

幻水２は何度も周回したけど、本作品は全員仲間にしてほぼ全員Lv99にして満足してそこで止まってしまった。
クリア目前だけど、なんかやる気にならないんだよね。
一周に２個ぐらいルーン開放のアイテムあったり、ステ底上げのアイテムあったりしたら、推しキャラ育てる楽しみもあったのにちょっと残念。
キャラゲーでもあるのに、最強キャラを設定してしまったのは、良くも悪くもかな～って思います。

So, after hearing all the complaining about this game and having opted to give it a fair shake, here's my two cents:

- It's a solid retro JRPG and many of its downsides are the result of it being too faithful to old school game design/mechanics. It's valid if those choices annoy you, but as far as I know the game was always meant to be like this. Hell, comparing it to real old school stuff I've recently played like, say, Shining Force, this game is positively modern in every way.
- IMO it looks good and the characters are fun enough even if tropey. It manages to feel consistent with the prequel even if that one was a Metroidvania-ish adventure game and this one is a turn-based RPG.
- The whole tantrum in some circles about woke dialogue and terrible localization is kind of  ridiculous. That throwaway line about being sure if a golem is a he in context seemed to me more like " a golem is an it" kind of thing rather than some gender identity thing like people are trying to make it seem in order to complain. And even if for some reason it was a gender identity thing that made zero sense in context, it was a single line of dialogue and the other characters don't even react to it. I haven't run into any more of this really unbearable wokeism being shoved down my throat for roughly 10+ hours I've played it. If the game has one vaguely "woke" line of dialogue per 10 hours, I'd say flipping out because of the politics they inserted into it makes you look like a crybaby.
- The complaints about a slow pace and simplistic and not terribly engaging story are fair. I just played Rise of the Third Power, a much humbler indie game,  and it does a much better job of portraying different factions engaging in political scheming while some try to prevent an all out war from breaking out. That game keeps the pace going by pushing the main story and having the side quests be little detours you can do while progressing it without going out of your way that much, while this one often feels like you're mostly doing side quests that don't really matter and that feel like run of the mill filler. 

All in all, it's an okay game. Not as good as some of its defenders claim, but nowhere as bad as its detractors also claim.

I gladly supported this game with the effort from the devs and the creator of Suikoden (RIP).  But still I must treat this game with no bias.
[list]
[b] Pros [/b]
    [*]Lots of unique characters.
    [*]Really feels like an old school JRPG with lots of QoL improvements such as fast travel, autosave, autobattle with 'gambits' etc.
    [*]Base building, character recruiting was very enjoyable, reminiscent of Suikoden 1 & 2.
    [*]Graphics look great.
[/list]

[list]
[b] Cons[/b]
    [*]Story was not good and the pacing did not feel natural.
    [*]World and game actually felt very small after a certain point.  You meet characters from other towns but are never able to visit these places (maybe in the DLC?).  The world map awkwardly looks very empty.
    [*]Too many of the minigames were very basic.  Either not interactive (racing), just RNG (cooking, fishing) or felt very basic (Duels, war battles)
    [*]Game felt too easy.
[/list]

現在30時間程度プレイして中盤辺りですが、はっきりクソだと言い切れるレベルで呆れ果ててます。
表面的には幻想水滸伝2の皮を被った、懐古趣味ゲーです。なので普通に遊び、普通に進める事はできます。しかし数多く登場するキャラクターを満遍なく使ってみたいとか欲を出した途端に、このゲームの「何も考えてない」薄っぺらな現実に叩きのめされるでしょう。これ作った連中、本当に何も考えてないのだと思います。何もかもデタラメでペラッペラ、ゲーム世界にまともに向き合うのが馬鹿馬鹿しくなる事間違いありません。
一例として、中盤に仲間になるジジイとババアを挙げましょう。ジジイは槍の達人として知られたキャラで、主人公は「～という噂を聞いた」という体で話しかけるのですが、こっちはそんなの初耳です。その場で戦闘（一騎打ちではなく）になって勝利すれば仲間になります。弱いです。
ジジイを仲間にした後、ジジイをババアの所に連れていくとババアが仲間になります。ババアは格闘家（遠距離）でジジイのライバル、現状負け越しているという設定ですが、ババアのステは全てジジイの1.5倍くらいあります。
全然勝負になりません。誰がどう見てもババアの圧勝です。このゲームこんなんばっかです。他にもゲーム開始直後から仲間の女サムライはザコ中のザコです。ストーリー中度々メインキャラみたいな顔して出てきますが、使い所は皆無です。魔法使いキャラより力がありません。もうマジで何なんだこれ。

It's a mess of a game. There's a lot to do, and a lot that resembles Suikoden on surface level, but that's it: it's only a scratch deep. Beyond the initial resemblance, this game fails to reach any of the standards of Suikoden, which is rough, because its connection to the legendary game series is honestly its biggest strength.

Voice-Acting Quality is rough. Boss mechanics initially seem interesting but ultimately end up basically being coin flips or hastily slapped together mechanics, fittingly named 'gimmicks', than any sort of engaging means of gameplay. The story is forgettable, most of the game is designed to be played on auto-battle, even on normal difficulty, and what little genuine innovation there is in the form of some of the non-battle mechanics is frustratingly drowned by vague or non-existent information, necessary in order to engage in them properly. I can't count how many times I went through excessive tutorials, reading every line, only to find out that the one bit of information that [i]WASN'T[/i] already apparent was, for some reason, left out.

Chase all that with the fact that the map design doesn't facilitate ease of travel, nor does it seem like that gets much easier over time, and you have a boring, uninspired slogfest of half-baked gameplay that is riding on the coattails of a much beloved, unfortunately very dead game series.

RIP Suikoden. We miss you.

Some of the fight sequences where dumb too.  When you use CJ, Isha, Garoo, Nowa, Seign, and Marissa 6 hero combo, you get a massive icy dick on the screen.  Like I get it that the programers are having fun but cmon son.  It's fucking lame.  That and the game get WAY to easy as soon as you get certain characters. I really wanted to like this and the story seemed interesting along with the townbuilding aspect but:
The idea of having 100 characters seems great until you realize most of them are actively annoying, especially the women. It doesn't help that they say the same thing every time they do their skills.  Carrie got booted out of my party as soon as possible due to her "Made you look" voice line.  But she still says two lines, one before and one after, every single time you fast travel. Every. Single. Time.  And you'll be using it a lot.  Mellore repeats "Magic Missile" twice every battle.  Even the non-battle characters are annoying.  B'baba repeats the same line each time you confirm you want her to scry.
Gameplay is also dreadfully slow.  Opening up the menu and switching pages feels slow.  Combat feels slow, especially when a support character ability procs (the hot spring one takes so long).  Battle plan doesn't work as expected often, e.g. magic use when magic skills are not listed in priority actions.  Auto battle never uses heroic combos.  None of the stats are explained nor have I found a way to figure out how to use the elements or damage types as there's no info about the enemies available during battle.
UI generally is unpleasant, e.g. fast travel to the main base requires opening up the map, changing to the world map, and going to the second page of that.  Put it on the first page.
Limited item storage makes using the rune system painful.  Gotta know what you want to put on as well as character compatibility to know what to pull out of storage.
Drop rates are awful especially when several characters require grinding out items to recruit them.
Fishing is boring, but required for recruiting.  I don't want to play the top game, but it's required for recruiting.  I don't want to play the card game, but it's required for recruiting.  And recruiting is required for town building. 
So I stopped ~20 hours in.  Just wasn't looking forward to finding the next annoying character that I'd leave at my base forever.  The plot had one interesting character in Seign but he can't carry the whole game.

[h3]TL;DR [/h3]
I'm a backer of the Kickstarter campaign.
And Eiyuden Chronicles is not a bad game and deserves a positive recommendation.
But, it's a Mixed/Mostly Positive game that I would rate as a good 6/10, as there are many flagrant flaws in its: game design and combat stats, User experience and user interface, lack of polish in many places, absent sounds and glitched audio, very generic and unequal writing.

The team bit much more than they could chew, that's for sure. Yet, for the nostalgic factor of old rpg on the snes/ps1 era I believe it does scratch the itch; if only it could be at the height of stellar games of thoses eras...
 
[h3] TIME [/h3]
A full run-through took me 60h before I see the end credits. I'm quite a completionist in general so I try to complete all activities, but there are evident gating of some achievements behind an end-game (post-credits). The game can take you maybe a 100h to fully platinum; it needs to be said that those last 40 hours are a real pain and slog that I found completely unappealing and made me drop the game flat-out.


[h3]LORE/STORY [/h3]
The main story follow a thread that is very generic and shounen. It has many tropes and has (unlike it's inspired predeccessors Suikoden I & II) a very one-sided villain that is seen from a mile away. There are, in the side-quests, funny moments and some texts and characters that made me giggle either of cringe or cuteness, which is fine by me. Alas, there are aboslutely no "real meshing" in the main protagonists the justify their camaraderie. There is, overall, a overload of quantity of everything and a lack a quality as a whole,

[h3]GAMEPLAY [/h3]
Combat is nice, has a good flow and plays out in a very classic manner for a turn based RPG. Effects are nice and characters have impact. But, again, its marred by absurdly high mana costs that devoids all mages and healers for items until level 50-60's and upwards. A non-sensical limited inventory management that becomes more and more aggregious the further you progress, and bosses gimmicks that are very unequal in interests/fun factor.

Also, many of the 100's of characters have very limited kits of skills they can equip; which is fine, until you realize about 10 of them are actual very good and the rest is bottom barrel garbage that are useless... some protagonists included. It feels like this game was designed to not be fun, and not give players any agency and interesting "builds"; if only those they could control with the small team they had.

[h3]ART DIRECTION [/h3]
I have very few words for the Art Direction.
I found the monsters sprites to be very nicely done, as much as the character sprites. The issue lies in the environment and, more precisely, after we had the Star Ocean 2nd Story R remake not so long ago. It thought the environments and level designs lacked in cohesiveness if only to support puzzles that are sometimes very janky and old-fashioned. 

[h3]REPLAYABILITY [/h3]
i think in a straight-line without participating in activities and side-quests or finding everyone the game takes about roughly 30-40 hours or so, give or take. A full completionists run though might take you about an 100 hours or more. The end game consists of boss rush battles and a secret hidden dungeon at the moment; all other content are tedious side activities not related to combat: fishing, egg races, cooking, cards collection, beigomas battles (beyblade) and the likes.

[h3]AUDIO [/h3]
Okay. Why is there no audio for footsteps?
The very basic sound that grounds the character(s) in the universe are non-existant. Also, when defeating multiple ennemies at once with AoEs, they sounds all adds up cranking up their volume twice or thrice. Sometimes voices are loud and the music is not, other times its the opposite, why? Please devs play with your headphones on your heads! This is ridiculous.

The OST though, is very good although very repetitive, there are variants of the battle theme, and enough thematics per countries/dungeons/biomes to have a nice grasp of the soundscape of each seperate nation.

As for the Localisation issues others brought, I,m no Japanese expert so I won't mention if it's bad or not; but I'll say some english actors/actresses were very nicely coached and others were very unaware of what they were doing; to the point of hitting the cringe ceilling levels very often. The worst is that it's sometimes at very touching moments and it just makes every ounce of tension falls down the drain.

[h3]PERFORMANCE [/h3]
I never encountered any crashes, few dips here and there but overall very stable.
Had excellent FPS, I locked at 144 fps at DLSS 4K constantly.
No crash whatsoever.

On a good rig here:
4K 43" Monitor
RTX4090
AMD RYZEN 5950X
128GB DDR4 3600Mhz
980Pro Samsung 2tb NVME Drive

[h3]CONCLUSION [/h3]
It's a shame. And I know I bashed the game for a 6 million budget game, but the reality is this game is sold at
64.99 CDN$ if not on sale. I have to rate it like a "semi high budget game" it tries to sell itself at.

The tedious back and forth in menus to manage items and all it's bloat, the audio glitches, the very toned-down and barebone stats limitations and poor classes choices concerning mana and defenses makes this game a very bizarre take on what could've been a very enjoyable experience. Add to that a story without much cohesion and overall meshing that you wonder what all those kickstarter goals meant in the end if the foundation wasn't so good after all.

I wish Rabbit & Bear all the best, but now that we seee DLC's, packages, Raodmaps and shits that were supposed to be handed out to backers and we actually never got after months, I will not be backing the follow-up the studio plans to make in the future.

Honestly, go try it on Gamepass if it's there! 
But don't buy this at full price, regardless of small studio or not. 
I'd fully heartedly recommend this game at 30$ or less, else it's not worth the shot in my opinion.

Un juego al estilo Suikoden II. Con casi  la misma dinamica en los personajes principales que aquel juegazo, linda musica, buen grafico a lo que se puede esperar a un jrpg de este estilo. Las batallas aleatorias insufribles a mi parecer, jugué con desesperacion hasta encontrar el anillo para que aprezcan menos encuentros...

I would like to give this a NO, but gave it a yes overall... and here is why:  Nostalgia VS Random glitchy bugs, a couple of game crashes, a weak story, and multiple ridiculously long and over-complicated puzzles that left me wanting to scream....  It will be a very long time before I re-install and try to beat this game.  (Just un-installed after nearly 59 hours of game play due to a crash during a cutscene after the final battle with no chance to save.)  The only reason I say yes to this is because, if you are a dedicated lover of the Suikoden games, and you are interested and willing to give it a try, then go for it.  But it has left me disappointed.  Many of the fun things from Suikoden were added into this game (cooking battles, plays, etc.) - and this really brought that huge wave of nostalgia for me that I was wanting with this purchase.   Sadly, that is the only reason I would suggest someone playing this game.  If you are not a die-hard fan of Suikoden, or old JRPGs in general, then you might want to go play something else...

そのほか細かい所も含めて妙に出来の悪い部分が多く
・カメラワークが悪く、キャラクターが見えなくなるポイントがかなり多い(カメラ移動・回転不可)

・メッセージの一括表示が存在せず、やたら遅い表示速度に加えてその辺のMOBキャラにいたってはボタンを押すとメッセージ表示が終わっていなくてもメッセージ送りが発動するので会話が面倒、テンポが悪い(しかもアイテムくれるMOBがいたりするので質が悪い)
・移動速度に比べてマップが無駄に広い、ダンジョンはともかく街は移動が面倒(いつまで使うか知らないが、プロローグ終了後の街なんかは入り口から宿泊・セーブ・パーティ編成等を行える宿屋まで約30秒かかる)
・シナリオ進行が分かりづらい、イベントの配置の仕方がFCみたい、いつのゲームだよ

後は表現等に統一性がない
最序盤プロローグ終了後都市っぽい所から始まるが、住人はここを「街」と表現、これはまだいい
ただ人口のほとんどが村人で町人が少々、手ぬぐいにエプロン？な村娘っぽい住人がいればスーツ着たおっさんがその辺を歩いていたり、フルプレート兵士がいればそれでいて序盤のくぎゅーは魔法少女だったりと、世界観がわけわからん
西洋風なのか東洋風なのか、アジア風なのかファンタジー風なのかメルヘン風なのか、もう何が何やら・・・
アマチュアのツクール作品でももうちょっと統一感があるぞ

JRPGであることをやたら通しているが、アピールできる部分がそこしかなかったというか、それ以外割といい加減に作ったんじゃないかと思えてしまう・・・

幻想水滸伝１．２をプレイしてストーリー重視で購入したのですが、メインの話の進み方も仲間になるメンバーの会話も内容が薄すぎてついていけません。

序盤も序盤ですが、ぽんぽんと主人公の警備隊の期間が進み仲間集めしてこいといわれ一部の仲間候補の勧誘からあんたは重要な使命を背負ってる的なことを何名かに言われあっさり仲間になるんですが、そんな描写ありましたかってぐらい意味不明です。主人公、新人警備隊として数か月働いてただけですよね・？主人公もなぜか肯定気味に流して会話終わりですし。

その後も、正義と騒いでる少女を「危ないから追いかけて助けなきゃ」ってキャライベントが流れた後にふつーにメインイベントと思われる会話が始まり「じゃあ山超えて故郷にいこうか」って何事もなかったように話がはじまちゃって、話繋がらないなーって不満が出つつもメインと反対に進み助けにいこうとダンジョンについてみたらキャラいないし、おかしいなと思って町もどったらメインと同じ場所で「東ってどっち」とかいう短いイベントでやっとフラグが立って、今度こそダンジョンでイベントの会話が始まったと思ったら敵認定されて、会ったばっかりだよなと思いつつも理不尽だけど会話の流れ的に戦闘かとおもったら暗転して何事もなかったように勘違いでしたと会話が終わり、ボス倒しに行きましょう！

私はここでやめました。会話の内容も主人公の何も考えてなさそうな返答もだめでした。かなりざっくり切り取って説明しましたが、ゲームの会話もこれぐらい薄っぺらい説明と同じぐらいの会話に感じました。
声優さんが声をつけてくれたので余計にキャラが生々しくこれで会話成り立っていいのって思える場面が多すぎです。
長々と個人的な感想を書いて申し訳ないのですが、読んで共感することがあれば私はおすすめはしません。

ゲームシステムとかは他の方が散々書いているので私はストーリーやキャラの魅力についてレビューします。
どうしても幻想水滸伝ⅠとかⅡ（以下幻水）と比べてしまうという事もあり正直ストーリーやキャラは薄味、甘く見積もっても50～60点です。
①幻水と比べて各キャラの掘り下げが無いか浅く、登場キャラは多いが主要キャラ以外はその魅力が伝わってこない。
②個性のあるキャラの死が終盤までない、または描かれていない（〇〇が暗殺されたとか、とあるキャラの家族が死んだとかはあるがそのキャラ自身は登場せずそういうセリフや文章が流れるだけ）のでノスタルジーなどが感じられない。
③幻水では軍師不在の間の奮闘と苦戦が良く描かれていた事もあり軍師キャラの魅力が増していたが今回はそういう流れが薄い。一応軍師はいるし策を出してそのおかげで勝てたってなってるけど『物語上そう言ってるだけ』という印象になってしまった。
④戦争も幻水に比べて大味、ストーリー上は色々策を弄してるけど戦争モードでは大体バフ打って正面からぶつかり合うだけで幻水みたいな兵種同士の相性とかが無い。試行錯誤して勝つ要素がない。
⑤魅力的な敵キャラの不在。幻水Ⅰのテオとか五将軍、Ⅱのルカ・ブライトとかクルガンとかシード、ジョウイみたいな魅力的な敵キャラが少ないと感じた。
色々書きましたがあくまで「幻想水滸伝と比べてしまうと」という見方だった場合です。
まだ1作目ですし今後Ⅱとか発売されて今回のキャラ達も掘り下げられたりしていく事を期待しています。

Long time Suikoden fan here.  I came out of J-RPG retirement for this game b/c I always felt we, the Suikodenians, never truly got a good follow up after II. 

The Pros: 
-The game looks great, the sprites are great.
-The voice acting is actually done well.
-The combat is quick, just like it was in the first 2 Suikodens even though they devs didn't allow for characters and enemies to execute their actions simultaneously whenever it doesn't conflict with other actions (just a minor complaint in an otherwise fast combat system)

The Cons:
-The main character is bland and doesn't have a compelling story to make you really invest in his mission
-The story its pretty generic and some of the characters are to similar to some from Suikoden II.
-The fact that that game shows you maps for whatever dungeon you're in is bad.  The dungeons have less of an exploratory feel b/c you can see all the paths in an area before you even explore it.  
-All the choppy breaks for very trivial dialogue also makes everything a slog.  Every time you move the story along or reach something critical, the screen goes black, then loads the exact same location with all the characters present to then start dialogue.  This is needlessly tedious.  Why not have the characters walk out of the main characters avatar like most J-RPG's do of old?

In short the game just feels a bit unpolished and I feel that they just got it "good enough" and pushed it out the door.  Its not a bad game, but its not great and I don't recomend it. 

This was made abundantly clear when at one point in the game, the main protagonist has to fight a duel with another character.  This actually wasn't a bad thing, except during the fight, both characters get knocked off the bridge and continue the fight on the river bank below away from their respective parties.  At this point, I thought that my remaining party would then start a boss battle with the previousely alluded to tank boss while the duel still goes on below.  This would have been surprising and amazing as it would have taken my Suikoden expectations and then flipped them on my head for what would have been an memorable scene/fight.  Instead, the duel just continues on the bank below the bridge and the protagonist loses the fight.  Immediatly, the screen goes black.  Would I then have the remaining members of my party fight a boss and then come to the characters rescue?  Nope, both the protagonist and his foe just magically appear on the bridge above with the main character near death but not dead to only be saved in the nick of time by the remaining troops from the good guys.  

Another instance of this is in the begining of the game and you're just given a "hey, just go recruit some people" mission and you just wonder around aimlessly.  This wouldn't be so bad if this exploration paid off but most of the areas are partially closed off so you can go to them but don't really know you need to until you've already explored them a bit.  Just fluff and not as cleanly put together as the older suikoden games.

The game isn't perfect but I miss Suikoden so much. My favorite is Suikoden 2 & 5 due to their story line and the many meaningful characters, with their own personality and engagement throughout the game.  But do give this game a try. I personally enjoyed it.

I played Suikoden's 1-3 when I was a kid/teenager and was somewhat stoked to play this game when I decided to support its kickstarter.  I'm going to compare it a lot to the Suikoden series while trying to be relatively unbiased. 

Gameplay - 

 For the battles, it's just ok. 6 characters in battle + 1 support. The supports do have different abilities but I rarely swapped them out unless I was trying to forage or get specific items. The actual battle themselves aren't particularly interesting, i felt more annoyed than anything. I don't really play RPGs anymore, so I forgot how annoying and tedious these games can be with the grinding and random battles.
When you're fighting, Combined attacks are really underwhelming and the runes are a bit uninteresting for both magic and physical damage. Monsters also hit suprisingly hard for no reason. 

Duels feel relatively soul-less. In the Suikoden series, generallythere was some weight to a duel and it made the fights feel more epic, whereas in Eiyuden,  duels have no heart and it might be due to the story and its development. Like, some of these duels feel random. Having said all that, the duels do have some cool animations and music. 

I think one of my biggest frustrations was having to run through an entire dungeon after defeating a boss to pick up hidden loot. I also dislikedd the Bakugan mini-game, it's so dumb and the game doesn't explain anything. The cooking mini-game isn't the most intuitive either but I found it charming. 

Story -

 It's fine... but I'm also on the boat that thinks most JRPGs have mediocre storylines. In the past, Suikoden games would make me feel a bit sad or emotional and Final Fantasy storylines kept me on the edge of my seat due their originality. Maybe it's because I'm older now, but I didnt feel anything while playing this game. Imo, it's predictable and boring. 

The characters do have a nice variety in personalities but most lack actual development and that may be due to the amount of them. Some of them are also extremely annoying. Like there are a few who are actually good but I cant stand to use them due to the voice acting you'll hear pre/post battle. 

Graphics -

Solid and nothing to write home about. I enjoy the sprite models and 2Dish landscapes. If you don't care for them, you wont like it. 


Overall, I think if you're a fan of the SUikoden series, I'd wait for a sale. It's an ok game and will scratch that itch but i don't find it particularly fun or rewarding to play. Hopefully there will be a sequel and they can make some QOL changes and get a good storyline.
