幻水 1 2 3 百年交至 黄道轮回 通关玩家表示 爽就完事了 但要把老太婆无法入队的bug修了 。玩的不爽觉得别扭对老式JJRPG有偏见的小鬼爬 你们不是受众。兔子熊的爹是微软 不差你们那点B销量。

The game was great for me, overall i like it.

1. Story 10/10 : Its give Suikoden 2 vibe, its a bit less dark than the Suikoden 2, but not too different.
2. Character 10/10 : Most of the character was good, all of them have their own loveable quirk. 
Based for my own opinion, Nowa, Seign, and Lian felt like Riou, Jowy, and Nanami relationship. [spoiler] Nowa and Seign are best friend like Riou and Jowy, and Lian, despite not a sibling like Riou and Nanami, but Lian teased Nowa a lot, like how Nanami teased Riou back in Suikoden 2. [/spoiler]
3. Translation 5/10 : Its because lots of adding some new word/sentence or translated it into a completely different word. But its not as bad as what people keep complaining about, and while i personally didn't approve it, hence why i only gave 5/10, but i could understand why the translator did it. Most of time i only hear what they say instead of reading the translation, so its not a big deal for me.
The biggest example was how Lian teased Nowa a lot in translation, which people falsely claimed that its not happen in JP voice. In fact, it does happen in JP voice too, it just in JP voice, she teased Nowa with her voice tone. Most of time she talk to Nowa, she use a voice tone to talk against someone below her/far younger that her, but its in friendly fun way, not as an insult. As it was a voice tone, a mere translation text won't be able convey it, so the translator add some new teasing. People should know that this is not only text to text translation, it got Seiyuu voice too. Check their voice tone too instead of directly translating it. The translation didn't change the character personality nor the story.
4. Gameplay 10/10: The same old turn base RPG like Suikoden, Combo attack, Rune Magic, etc. The additional battle gameplay with gimmick was interesting too. It seems no [strike]missable recruitment either[/strike] after playing till the end, looks like at least [spoiler]Leene[/spoiler] was missable, making it easier for me to play with my own pace. But even if its got missable character like Suikoden, i wouldn't mind too much. You guys gave a NG+ in here after all. Its not like i need to start from 0 again if i missed something. Also the townbuilding. Unlike Suikoden which the castle automatically get bigger after you recruited more character, this one need to getting materials and upgrade it manually, it make me feel more involved in the town building.
5. Mini-games 10/10 : 
-Fishing minigame make me feel like i playing fishing in Rune Factory game, the setup are similar. 
-For the Beigoma, [spoiler] First character got introduced for this, i was thinking "Why we got Yu-Gi-Oh character in here?", and then when picking the first Beigoma, "Why it feel like choosing a new Pokemon?" [/spoiler], kind of wish there is an option to upgrade / increase Beigoma level. 
-The Card game, It was more fun than what i thought when i see it in the trailer. Not hard to do either once you get use to the game.
- Eggfoot racing : Raising and breeding those Eggfoot for the race was fun, kind of wish the Eggfoot parent won't disappear when we breed them, but i guess that would make the minigame became too easy. Also kind of wish there is no race limit for the Eggfoot, forcing us to keep breeding them even after we make the ultimate Eggfoot.
- Theater : Its fun but also hard at the same time to find the right combination for getting the highest score, need to pick the right one from 120 characters after all. Also, i think it would be more nice if there is additional dialogue for a specific character combination.
- Cooking : Same like the old Suikoden 2 Cooking mini game, it was fun to play and see the judges reaction for some of the food, but its very hard to get good score for all of the judges.
6. Graphic 10/10 : The character design, map, town, etc game Suikoden vibe. It is a nice good looking graphics.

There is only 1 thing i don't like. That we cannot give the castle name manually. I have the castle name that i have been used for a long time in Suikoden series. But now, i cannot use it since the game forced me to pick from the available name.

Yoshitaka Murayama passed away on my birthday. When the news struck, I cried. He was the creator of my favorite game, Suikoden ii. That game means the world to me. He is the reason why I play JRPGs and I am forever grateful to him. It brings me so much joy that I am able to play Eiyuden, an ode to the first two Suikoden games of the series. Most of the characters and parts of the story feels familiar which puts a smile on my face. I feel as if I am reliving my childhood once more and its a dream come true. I do enjoy the game as its own thing too. Rest in peace and thank you for everything.

Eiyuden Chronicle: Hundred Heroes is a prime example of why turn-based JRPG is its own genre. Story, gameplay, animation, optimization and soundtrack are crafted with intricate passion. This game has EVERYTHING the genre could offer. Worth every single rupiah. They don't mess around with the lore and world building aspect of this game either. You'll know what I'm talking about if you play Eiyuden Chronicle: Rising before. They lay it out on you in a way that it won't make you feel overwhelmed and that gives you a lot of freedom to do anything at your own pace. Congratulations to all party involved in the making of this masterpiece and I don't throw that word around casually. I'm trying to keep it cool but I'm so overjoyed right now! Rabbit & Bear Studios, I salute you!

現状49/100点でギリギリおすすめできないレベルです。

クラファン開始の初日に支援したバッカーですが、とにかくUI・システム・シナリオ（のノリ）が古い、想定以上に古い。
古き良き時代のアレを超えた古さで、不便さ・イライラを感じるレベルで最初は強い拒否感がありました。


しかし人間は慣れるもので、謎のウェイト、デフォで装備を売る設定、インベントリの少なさ、単調なバトル、セリフ自動送りでNPCの会話が読めない等は、そういうもんだと思えるようになってきます。とりあえず15時間ほどは遊んでみました。


が、とにかくエンカウント率が低く（1分あるいて1回）、レベルが上がらない。
敵との戦闘でレベル補正がかな～～～～り大きいため、「レベル上げ」が必至なのですが、これにかなりの時間が取られます。
これほんとなんとかしてほしい。

また「おまかせバトル」では回復行動を設定してないにも関わらず、なぜか勝手にやくそう・復活薬を使ってくれるので、ダンジョンを普通に歩くとボス戦で在庫がなくなってます。

そういうバランス調整なんだろうか・・・おかしいよ。

さらにはおまかせバトル中にメンバーのHP・MPが一切確認できない。
マニュアルプレイでも画面外で攻撃食らってるケースが有り、ダメージ確認できなかったり・・・何だこれが多い。


シナリオもすごくスローに進んでいきます。序盤5、6時間程度で物語が大きく動き始めようとしますが、主人公にやる気があまりやる気をみせず、なすがままに進んでいく1本道ストーリーで、そこからさらに10時間程度やりましたが、盛り上がってるようにみせて盛り上がってないという。
仲間探しはフリーといいつつも行動エリアはかなり狭く制限されており、自由度はかなり低いです。

ルーン（スキル）も自由につけ外しできるということだが、剣士系は剣士系という感じで元のクラスの系統ごとに制限があり、固有スキルでも枠は取られちゃうので、こちらも自由度はないに等しい。

拠点にしても拡張に必須の英雄が存在するおかげで、こちらも拡張の自由度はない。

釣りやベーゴマ、演劇といったミニゲームは最序盤から匂わせているものの、なかなか開放されない。


開発陣いわく「自分でどうやって快適にしていくかを考え、拡張することで遊びやすさが上がっていく。」ということだが・・・
例えば移動速度アップについて言うと、アクセサリーを装備することで移動速度が上がるものがあります。

これはパーティメンバーの誰かが装備していれば効果を発揮しますが・・・イベントでちょくちょく主人公だけだったり、二人っきりだったりということがあるんですよね。
別のメンバーに装備させていた場合、そのたびに移動速度は下がります！！

だからといって主人公に装備させるとなると・・・1枠しかない貴重なアクセ枠でステータスアップができない。
つまりはレベル補正（つまりはステータス補正）がデカいゲームなので、戦力がかなり下がることに・・・。


こういうのが良いんだという方もいるでしょうが、あの頃出てたならまだしも、自分的にはギリギリなしかな～。

当時の物を当時のまま現代に持ってこられても困る・・・というのが正直なところ。
面白くないわけじゃないんだけど、アップデート待ってからでいいな～、という感想。
（まあその頃には存在を忘れ去っていそう・・・）
好玩，就是感觉这种画质优化好像不太好，风扇嘎嘎转

Eiyuden Chronicles: Hundred Heroes ist ein wahr gewordener Traum für Liebhaber klassischer JRPGs und ein eindrucksvolles Zeugnis für die Leidenschaft und Hingabe seiner Entwickler. Als Fan von Spielen wie Suikoden habe ich mich seit Jahren nach einem spirituellen Nachfolger gesehnt, und Eiyuden Chronicles erfüllt diese Erwartungen mit Bravour.

Die Grafik, die von handgezeichneten 2D-Sprites bis hin zu detaillierten Umgebungen reicht, ist eine Augenweide und vermittelt eine charmante Nostalgie, während sie gleichzeitig modernen Standards gerecht wird. Die Musik, komponiert von hochtalentierten Künstlern, fängt die Atmosphäre jeder Szene perfekt ein und trägt dazu bei, eine tiefgreifende emotionale Bindung zum Spiel aufzubauen.

Die Geschichte von Eiyuden Chronicles entfaltet sich auf fesselnde Weise und präsentiert eine Vielzahl von faszinierenden Charakteren, von denen jeder eine eigene Geschichte und Motivation hat. Das Gameplay ist ein raffinierter Mix aus rundenbasierten Kämpfen, strategischem Basismanagement und einer Vielzahl von Nebenaktivitäten, die es schwer machen, sich vom Bildschirm loszureißen.

Was dieses Spiel wirklich auszeichnet, ist jedoch die Liebe zum Detail und die Wertschätzung für die Traditionen des Genres. Von kleinen Anspielungen auf vergangene Klassiker bis hin zu innovativen Gameplay-Mechaniken, die das Genre vorantreiben, ist Eiyuden Chronicles ein Liebesbrief an JRPG-Fans weltweit.

Insgesamt kann ich Eiyuden Chronicles: Hundred Heroes uneingeschränkt empfehlen. Es ist nicht nur ein fantastisches Spiel für alteingesessene Fans klassischer JRPGs, sondern auch ein beeindruckendes Werk, das neue Spieler in seinen Bann ziehen wird. Ein absolutes Muss für jeden, der die Magie der goldenen Ära der Rollenspiele erleben möchte.

I played Suikoden II back when this game was announced, as I'd heard a lot of great things about it, so I was definitely curious. In anticipation of this game, I have also played the spin-off Eiyuden Chronicle: Rising, which was pretty mind-numbing, and something I pushed myself through as quickly as possible. 

I'm not a backer, but I have been an interested lurker throughout the games' development.

I apologize in advance for a pretty negative review. In general, I'm actually mid to positive on the game (unfortunately Steam doesn't allow a neutral review), but there's definitely a feeling of a death by a thousand cuts here. Lots of little annoyances and frustrations add up, which has led to my current outlook.

I don't hate it, I just wish it lived up to my expectations more. I wanted an enhanced, modernized, and improved Suikoden experience. Instead, I just got a Suikoden experience. That might be exactly what some people want, but it's not what I wanted.

At times, the game is great, but most of the time, it's very mid. I can't recommend it at full price unless you've specifically played similar titles and want more (quite literally, more of the same). If that isn't you, then I'd really recommend waiting for a sale.

[h3]The Bad:[/h3]

This is a list of things that are needed to improve the game:

- Better English translation (sometimes it's not even close to the Japanese dub and left me wondering if the translation team would have preferred to be the writing team with the liberties they're taking)

- Graphically, the sprites are great, but don't fit in the 3D world whatsoever. In general, the 3D world has very minimal detail and is very sparse at best. It's just not fantastical whatsoever. There's a moment where you cross over a rope bridge between two canyons and I sat back expecting a wide camera shot to show off the environment and... nothing. Blurry blobs in the background that are rough mountains. No vista, no nothing. During set pieces there is an artistic vision, but that vision is not shared with the other 99% of the experience

- Monsters/bosses are not pixel sprites and lead to this weird clashing of art styles. I don't inherently prefer sprites to 3D, but please just pick one as the art director and stick with it, then everything would just gel better. I am a huge fan of the Octopath Traveller series, though, so perhaps I'm spoiled in that sense (Team Asano are incredible)

- The quasi open-world elements are empty and tedious to run through

- There is no sprint button, you have to dungeon delve for an equippable item that boosts run speed. Why? There's a button for walking, though...

- Battles need to move faster. For random encounters, it's largely a one hit-KO deal, but you'll be there for close to a minute regardless

- Button inputs need to be accepted faster (menu scrolling is a delayed nightmare, as is spamming 'attack' in battle)

- No main character avatars are present during the 'war' battles, instead replaced with generic character models that come from the early 2000s (it almost looks like I'm playing The Settlers 2 HD). At times, you will see a speech bubble from a recruited hero, but it's just so basic that it leaves you frustrated that there isn't more

- The war battles are slow, need a fast-forward option, and really aren't that fun whatsoever. They were interesting in Suikoden II, and I was expecting more, and I wanted a true evolution because it's a really cool mechanic! Unfortunately, they were just underwhelming to the point of almost being embarrassing. They could be removed entirely, and we won't have lost anything (perhaps we would have gained elsewhere as a result)

- The menu buttons are inconsistent. Sometimes, you can press the back button, and it'll exit a prompt, other times you won't be allowed to do that and have to press a specific button instead

- Pacing. There are times when I'm having lots of fun and then the game will jackknife into hours long sections that are incredibly slow and dull. After the initial HQ you have three routes to explore, all of which have an NPC 1/5th of the way in saying you can't progress any further. Why??? What's the point in having an open-world if I can't go off and explore? 

- Some heroes are incredibly annoying, but you'll be stuck with them for several hours because you need them to fill a specific role

- It's not always clear what range a character has, or why. So you'll often blindly experiment, hoping for the best. I don't see why we can't change formation mid-battle either

- Healers are effectively pointless. With such large MP costs for healing, you feel like you need to horde MP for boss battles - but then when you do, you'll quickly find that after 2-3 casts you're spent. Not to mention, there's really no use for offensive magic. Well, back to spamming items then...

- Except that you have an inventory limit. Because you have such limited healing ability, you'll find that even with maxed healing items you'll be running on fumes by the end of a dungeon, limping your way through. It's just as well the random encounters are weirdly timed

- Character designs are voices are incredibly mismatched at times, it's actually kind of impressive how wide this gap can be

- Scripted sections will occasionally have you follow this pattern: talk > awkwardly run > battle > talk > player manually runs > talk > battle > repeat 4-5 times. I appreciate it's to give me time to heal, but it breaks the tension immediately, and really just serves to highlight that they know healing is a gameplay issue and as such, solve it by giving you a break after every scripted encounter

- Occasionally you'll get weird audio artefacts. One character voice will be far louder than another, then another will suddenly have way more bass than their previous line. Or you'll get the music not fading out correctly when moving between one area to another

- Character speeds are often far lower than enemies. This means that you might get one attack off before they hit you. Except that enemies often attack in rows or columns, so one random encounter can brutally punish you just for existing

[h3]The Good:[/h3]

Okay, that was a lot of bad. Here's some good:

- The music is mostly great, the big scenes hit well, and the dungeon themes are surprisingly dynamic and interesting

- Boss battles are mostly interesting, though do suffer a bit from being damage sponges. There are 'gimmicks' (what an awful, awful naming convention by the way, why aren't they called tactics?) that are boss-specific environmental systems/attacks. They can at times be a chance-based system too, which gets annoying, but overall if the pace was quickened they'd be great

- The battle system in general is great. The camera (when it works) is really dynamic and gives it a sense of fluidity. I'm hoping it gets more tactical/strategic later on with more character combinations and abilities

- The story is quite interesting so far. When the writing is good, it's great

【百英雄伝】

（幻水）幻想水滸伝 2 >  幻想水滸伝 1 > 【百英雄伝】>  販売価格

--
1) お値段以上。
2) 但し、幻水１、幻水２には及ばず。
3) 完成度は想定以下。ゲームシステム、トリガー設定、セリフ反応、シナリオ表現、各種導入等々。


＜　シナリオ　方向性　＞
合理性重視の感じ、「運命の数奇」を抑えて（幻水１と比較）。
更に国所属の相違で、必ずどちらが悪とは限らない世界観（幻水２と類似、但し幻水２では明らかな悪役が有り）。

少なくとも【百英雄伝】は物語の中盤まで、ストーリー進行の指向性、動機の強さは幻水１、幻水２以下。ストーリー推進、緊迫感を与える「（ボス）役」は不在。

国同士間も「大人の対応」で、表立って「戦争するぞ！」ではないので（現実／史実と類比？）、主人公側もあまり騒ぎ立てるしずらい。劇作の背景設定としてはより深みが有るかもしれないが、ゲームにとって演出されてない物或いは描写は、やはり存在しないと大概等しい、感じにくい。冒頭に主人公の家族と元生活の描写が殆どないのも、プレイヤーがその世界に起きたことに感情移入／共感にくい一因。


なお、権利関係上いろいろ「もどき」が出てくる、ビッキーもどきとか。



＜　音楽　＞
ゲームの場面と一緒に記憶に残る…の様なことはない。
ゲーム抜き、単純に音楽自体を聴いて、特に素晴らしいと感じることもない。

Très bon jeu qui a quelques petits défauts d'optimisation mais comme pratiquement tous les jeux à leur sorties. Si vous avez aimé suikoden, vous allez kiffer ce jeu !

众筹用户，在苦等4年，经历了延期、进XGP、众筹用户不如狗、运费要加钱等一系列骚操作之后。
总算等到游戏本体给发货了。然而PS5实体版亚洲用户最后一批发，还是从美国发货，美国人本地人都玩了半个月玩腻了。这价格和时间成本，远不如直接本地预购。
和客服扯一顿总算是拿到了一个steam版激活码尝鲜，还不带DLC就是了。

闲话抱怨说完，说一下目前游戏前期的体验。
本作作为《幻想水浒传1&2》精神续作，像素风格，一百多个可加入队友，战斗前后排的设计，符文和和合作攻击，战术设置等老系统都有。还有一些小游戏和详细的帮助提示。
语音和对话比较多，虽然这么多人不可能全程语音，但对于各种人物组合都单独设计了语音和内容，不容易，所以导致游戏容量也很大。

但是也就仅此而已了，很难想象一个2024年的游戏还搞这么多限制玩家的设计。
1. 不能随时存档，甚至在城镇和大地图都不行，自动存档从迷宫入口开始。
2. 野外没有回复点，升级也没有回复。草药性价比极高，建议能多买则多买。
3. 踩地雷式遇敌，虽然普通难度下频率很低，但如果你想刻意练级或者弹尽粮绝急于撤退就很麻烦。（听说是高刷新率下遇敌率会降低，就很离谱）
4. 阵亡队友无法获取经验，我估计之后队友多了之后板凳队员也不太方便获取经验。
5. （目前看来）没有快速移动，战斗动画无法跳过。导致你大部分时候都在跑路和看战斗动画。
如果只是难度很高倒还好，但他又不是rogue和魂游戏。
6. 背包有数量限制，图鉴貌似也不能随时查看。
7. 各种可错过内容，影响成就获取。
8. 完全不支持鼠标操作，只能键盘或者手柄，键盘键位很不舒服也改不了（估计按主机平台设计的，对于手柄玩家来说倒也还好。
9. 还有纯随机战斗模式boss，导致你需要纯碰运气，或者练级碾压，而不能靠技术打过去，对于不喜欢练级的玩家来说很有挫败感。
等等……

本来当年幻水主打的就是剧情和一个人多，系统不算好的，更何况之后的幻水3已经做成3D了。在如今手游的天下，这么一个停滞不前的符合刻板印象的单机JRPG，除了怀旧玩家和媒体会吹捧以外，很难吸收新鲜血液。对于单机游戏发展毫无意义。

其他和上个月的支持者封测感觉基本没太大区别，存档也能直接读取，存档槽位从10个变成了20个。
中文翻译一般般，还需要持续优化。
